Clean Review: not realise bad audio setup considering used quite respectable setup many years ago feel trap using bluetooth speakers leave lot desired price provide perfect audio experience filling 3x3m room hardly auditorium quality amazing feel like subwoofer genres average listening experience without neighbours complaining beautiful almost brings tear eye
Review: i didn't realise how bad my audio setup was. considering i used to have quite a respectable setup many years ago i've feel into a trap of using bluetooth speakers which leave a lot to be desired. for the price these provide a perfect audio experience. now i'm only filling a 3x3m room so hardly an auditorium but the quality is amazing. i do feel like i could do with a subwoofer for some genres but for the average listening experience, without the neighbours complaining, it's beautiful. almost brings a tear to my eye.

Clean Review: wonderful monitors years since using monitors use dt770 250 audio work wow pleased added studio first sound sound quite flat good accurately eq sound bass even meaning not exaggerated mids well balanced sound great high end also fairly well balanced get nice air snap eqing bayer dynamic dt770 250 find headphones air snap bit highs default lower mids probably little punch not much going back forth 770 monitors similar ish experience build quality size petit size not take much room build absolutely fine price no issues standard connections means speaker wire phono 3 5mm unbalanced recommend using trs trs help eliminate noise emf backs also access bass treble knobs help tune sound room front power switch 3 5mm ports headphones phone play music phone via correct cable usually 3 5mm 3 5mm note headphone not powerful enough power 250ohm headphones overall monitors brilliant well worth price
Review: wonderful monitors. it's been some years since using any monitors as i use dt770 250's for all my audio work and wow, i'm so pleased i added these to my studio...first the sound...the sound is quite flat which is good as you can accurately eq your sound. the bass is "even", meaning that it's there but it's not exaggerated. the mids are very well balanced (they sound great) and the high end is also fairly well balanced and you can get some nice air and snap when eqing. for those that have the bayer dynamic dt770 250's, you'll find your headphones have more "air" and snap a bit more in the highs by default, the lower mids probably have a little more punch, but not much. going back and forth between the 770's and the monitors should be a similar(ish) experience...build quality and size..very petit in size, they don't take up much room. the build is absolutely fine for the price. no issues there...you have standard connections by means of speaker wire and phono to 3.5mm (unbalanced). i'd recommend using some trs to trs to help eliminate noise from emf...on the backs you also have access to bass and treble knobs to help tune the sound to your room...on the front you have the power switch and 3.5mm ports for headphones and phone so you can play music from your phone via the correct cable, usually 3.5mm to 3.5mm. just note that the headphone in isn't powerful enough to power 250ohm headphones...overall, these monitors are brilliant and well worth the price.
Title: wonderful monitors
Content: it's been some years since using any monitors as i use dt770 250's for all my audio work and wow, i'm so pleased i added these to my studio...first the sound...the sound is quite flat which is good as you can accurately eq your sound. the bass is "even", meaning that it's there but it's not exaggerated. the mids are very well balanced (they sound great) and the high end is also fairly well balanced and you can get some nice air and snap when eqing. for those that have the bayer dynamic dt770 250's, you'll find your headphones have more "air" and snap a bit more in the highs by default, the lower mids probably have a little more punch, but not much. going back and forth between the 770's and the monitors should be a similar(ish) experience...build quality and size..very petit in size, they don't take up much room. the build is absolutely fine for the price. no issues there...you have standard connections by means of speaker wire and phono to 3.5mm (unbalanced). i'd recommend using some trs to trs to help eliminate noise from emf...on the backs you also have access to bass and treble knobs to help tune the sound to your room...on the front you have the power switch and 3.5mm ports for headphones and phone so you can play music from your phone via the correct cable, usually 3.5mm to 3.5mm. just note that the headphone in isn't powerful enough to power 250ohm headphones...overall, these monitors are brilliant and well worth the price.

Review: crackling sound when connected to bluetooth. i‚Äôd like to preface this review by saying i tried 2 different sets of these speakers (both the bluetooth version), brand new, and both had the exact same issue, so must be a model issue rather than a one-off problem...the first pair i bought had a constant crackling/buzzing noise coming from the passive speaker when connected to bluetooth. the noise disappeared when disconnected from bluetooth, but appeared instantly when connected. it was audible at low volumes which ruined the listening experience so i exchanged for another set...this second set had the exact same problem. i tried connecting a different bluetooth device, i tried moving the speakers to different rooms, moving electrical devices away, swapping cables around‚Ä¶ but the noise would not disappear no matter what i tried...really disappointing and has massively turned me away from purchasing presonus products again...i started the returns process on 2nd may 2023, posted the item the same day, and still have not had a refund - today is 12th may 2023. would love an update on my refund please?

Review: perfect compact speakers. item came next day as promised and packaging was minimal but affective, great to see there was not excessive waste on paper !!..the speakers were very easy to connect, if you were not sure how to connect speakers there was some instructions !..to be honest for the size and price, i was very surprised. i have bang and olufsen speakers from the 90's which at the time cost ¬£300!! they are exceptional so was very dubious of the sound quality albeit they are for my son and his pc/playstation etc.. the sound was actually really sharp and the base was pretty good without any distortion or sound loss. the sound bands were pretty much together and not lost at all..whilst not exactly a match for my b&o, for the price i was so surprised. the sound is so good, and their compact size allows my son to have these on his shelf above him. pretty light weight but they do not compromise on sound..all in all for the price these are a worthy buy

Clean Review: everything ever wanted best sound ever presonus e5bt incredible clear sound reference speakers absolutely brilliant desktop setup laptop desktop computer ideal small studios e5bt gives excellent sound lots functionality easy setup pleasure use everything want front left speaker power volume line phones bt5 works well easy connect anything 5 inch driver gives full clear sound rear port adds solid accurate bass response eq flat pancake left speaker actively amped right passive amp jumps output 50w 5 better quality 3 4 inch 25w uniquely trs sub nice connecting sub quick easy cheap rear ported need space not bang brick wall basic acoustic modeling chosen speaker position possible controls rear speaker see end post studio setup lowest volumes need cut line volume freebie music software distraction don waste time get ableton e5bt quality clarity makes music production dream hear every detail every track picked modified levels accurately set dump cables supplied box get good quality shielded cable connectors tisino make trs stereo splitter cable amazon good choice basic direct computer connection 3 5 jack line voltages well shielded risk interference hum crosstalk pro speakers good practice switch power speakers first last accidental pops explosive cracks damage near field worth getting 5 inch no substitute shifting lots air 5 full solid bass double amp power get lots headroom distortion good value money speak
Review: everything you've ever wanted - best sound ever.. presonus e5bt incredible clear sound. these reference speakers are absolutely brilliant for a desktop setup with a laptop or desktop computer. ideal for small studios. the e5bt gives excellent sound, has lots of functionality, is easy to setup, a pleasure to use. everything you could want is on the front of the left speaker ‚Äì power, volume, line in, phones out, & bt5 that works very well ‚Äì easy connect anything. the 5 inch driver gives a full clear sound & the rear port adds a solid accurate bass response. eq as flat as a pancake. only the left speaker is actively amped, the right is passive. the amp jumps in output to 50w in the 5‚Äôs & is better quality - the 3 & 4 inch are 25w. uniquely there‚Äôs a trs sub-out which is nice, so connecting a sub is quick, easy & cheap. they are rear ported so they need some space ‚Äì not bang up against a brick wall. basic acoustic modeling for the chosen speaker position is possible with controls at the rear of the speaker - see end of post for studio setup. for the lowest volumes you‚Äôll need to cut the line volume. the freebie music software is a distraction, so don‚Äôt waste your time - get ableton..the e5bt‚Äôs quality & clarity makes music production a dream. you can hear every detail, so every track can be picked out, modified & levels accurately set. dump the cables supplied in the box & get some good quality shielded cable connectors. tisino make a trs stereo splitter cable from amazon - a good choice for a basic direct computer connection with a 3.5 jack. all line voltages should be well shielded or you risk interference, hum, crosstalk. as with all pro speakers its good practice to switch the power to the speakers - off first - on last - accidental pops & explosive cracks do damage..these are near field but it‚Äôs worth getting the 5 inch as there is no substitute for shifting lots of air ‚Äì the 5‚Äôs have a full solid bass & double the amp power, so you get lots of headroom before distortion. they are good value for money. these speak
Title: everything you've ever wanted - best sound ever.
Content: presonus e5bt incredible clear sound. these reference speakers are absolutely brilliant for a desktop setup with a laptop or desktop computer. ideal for small studios. the e5bt gives excellent sound, has lots of functionality, is easy to setup, a pleasure to use. everything you could want is on the front of the left speaker ‚Äì power, volume, line in, phones out, & bt5 that works very well ‚Äì easy connect anything. the 5 inch driver gives a full clear sound & the rear port adds a solid accurate bass response. eq as flat as a pancake. only the left speaker is actively amped, the right is passive. the amp jumps in output to 50w in the 5‚Äôs & is better quality - the 3 & 4 inch are 25w. uniquely there‚Äôs a trs sub-out which is nice, so connecting a sub is quick, easy & cheap. they are rear ported so they need some space ‚Äì not bang up against a brick wall. basic acoustic modeling for the chosen speaker position is possible with controls at the rear of the speaker - see end of post for studio setup. for the lowest volumes you‚Äôll need to cut the line volume. the freebie music software is a distraction, so don‚Äôt waste your time - get ableton..the e5bt‚Äôs quality & clarity makes music production a dream. you can hear every detail, so every track can be picked out, modified & levels accurately set. dump the cables supplied in the box & get some good quality shielded cable connectors. tisino make a trs stereo splitter cable from amazon - a good choice for a basic direct computer connection with a 3.5 jack. all line voltages should be well shielded or you risk interference, hum, crosstalk. as with all pro speakers its good practice to switch the power to the speakers - off first - on last - accidental pops & explosive cracks do damage..these are near field but it‚Äôs worth getting the 5 inch as there is no substitute for shifting lots of air ‚Äì the 5‚Äôs have a full solid bass & double the amp power, so you get lots of headroom before distortion. they are good value for money. these speak

Clean Review: not like first near field monitor speakers designed flat frequency response means need closer near ear height speaker separation dependent distance form optimum triangle complete recommended listening position unlike consumer speakers eq set speaker level provide uncoloured flat eq response gives accurate representation input sound source mix audio without adding unwanted eq bias straight box not tuned room acoustics not like slightly bass heavy due lower frequencies sound reflecting walls tweaked bass 1 db treble 1 db result perfect purposes bluetooth connectivity convenient function front switch volume control aux headphones great design features recommend using balanced trs inputs build quality product excellent not forget register software downloads handy setup tutorial
Review: did not like at first?. these are near-field monitor speakers designed to have a flat frequency response. this means they need to be closer to you at near-ear height, with speaker separation dependent on distance to form that optimum triangle you complete in the recommended listening position. unlike consumer speakers with eq set at speaker level, these provide an uncoloured flat eq response. this gives a more accurate representation of the input sound source, so now you can mix your audio without adding any unwanted eq bias. straight out of the box and not tuned to my room acoustics, i didn't like they were slightly bass heavy due to the lower frequencies of sound reflecting off walls. i tweaked the bass by -1 db and the treble by +1 db, the result is now perfect for my purposes. the bluetooth connectivity is just a convenient function for me, the front on/off switch, volume control, aux in and headphones out are great design features. i recommend using the balanced trs inputs. the build quality of this product is excellent. don't forget to register for software downloads and a handy setup tutorial.
Title: did not like at first?
Content: these are near-field monitor speakers designed to have a flat frequency response. this means they need to be closer to you at near-ear height, with speaker separation dependent on distance to form that optimum triangle you complete in the recommended listening position. unlike consumer speakers with eq set at speaker level, these provide an uncoloured flat eq response. this gives a more accurate representation of the input sound source, so now you can mix your audio without adding any unwanted eq bias. straight out of the box and not tuned to my room acoustics, i didn't like they were slightly bass heavy due to the lower frequencies of sound reflecting off walls. i tweaked the bass by -1 db and the treble by +1 db, the result is now perfect for my purposes. the bluetooth connectivity is just a convenient function for me, the front on/off switch, volume control, aux in and headphones out are great design features. i recommend using the balanced trs inputs. the build quality of this product is excellent. don't forget to register for software downloads and a handy setup tutorial.

Review: virtually unusable due to signal noise. tl;dr: don‚Äôt buy this subwoofer; it‚Äôs a terrible product that hums and hisses...i really wanted to love this subwoofer, but it‚Äôs basically unusable due to all the noise:..- it always hums when it‚Äôs powered on, even if it‚Äôs not connected to anything. another reviewer mentioned that‚Äôs a problem with the transformer and they fixed it by adding some padding to the transformer themselves. i can‚Äôt confirm: i don‚Äôt have such technical skills and i don‚Äôt think i should be expected to fix such things myself; could be a fire hazard!.- it introduces hissing noises to my eris 3.5 speakers when connected to my computer, even if i use an an external dac. these speakers do not pick up noise if i connect them to my computer directly without the subwoofer..- it introduces hissing noises to my eris 3.5 speakers when connected to my macbook every time i use my magic trackpad or magic keyboard. again, the eris 3.5 speakers do not hiss if not connected through the subwoofer...i have tried resolving the issue by using a power conditioner, and by trying different combinations of devices, cables, and wall sockets, but no joy. none of my other audio products have this problem. i can only conclude that this product has some some faulty or just plain bad electronics inside, maybe the transformer or amplifier...on the rare moments i got it to work without producing too much noise (apart from the hum) for a few moments it seemed to produce good sound, although i am no audiophile.

Review: amazing speakers, terrible software!. these speakers truly are the best sounding speakers i have ever owned, cristal clear, highs, lows, mids, they honestly are perfect. you will not be disappointed. i managed to get them on amazon monthly payment plan, which is just amazing! thank you amazon!!! :) there is a but, coming up though. the studio one software that's included with the speakers, is truly horrible to use, and with all of the plug ins and downloads, it took up, 'wait for it' 20 gig of my laptop's memory. 3 days of downloads and plug ins later, i was then able to actually start using the software, it's unbelievably unuser friendly, crashes all the time too, i imagine that's due to the huge amounts of memory it takes up on the laptop. truthfully, i deleted 'all' of the included software and went with another online music daw, that takes up no memory and is ultra user-friendly. but as far as the speakers go, amazing!!!!!

Review: the best budget monitors. these studio monitors definitely punch above their weight. having previously owned various sub-¬£100 monitors, i was expecting these to do the job but not blow me away. when i set them up i found the sound flat and clear - perfect for mixing...paired with a speaker eq software such as soundid, i've found that i don't feel like i need to upgrade these in the next few years...one benefit for me is that they don't use much power - i have a small room with only 1 plug socket so needed speakers that won't overload the socket. they get quite loud but those with larger rooms may want to opt for the next size up.

Review: so happy with this purchase ;). now i'm a cheapskate.... i needed to replace the cheap pc speakers i was using, so i opted for the cheapest pc speakers on amazon. big mistake. now i'm no audiophile, but these were terrible tinny speakers, and i couldn't bear listening to them a moment longer, so i sent them back immediately!..then i ordered these presonus studio monitors, and even though they were about 5x as expensive as the previous speakers they are 100% worth it!! these are simply awesome speakers, definitely the best speakers i have ever owned! they're a little larger than the average pc speakers, and you will need to also buy some quality phono leads to connect them to a pc, but the sound quality is superb and there is absolutely no hum or extraneous noise no matter how close the cables are to other electronics. one of the best purchases i ever made on amazon :)
Title: so happy with this purchase ;)

Clean Review: arrived damaged set smaller monitors desktop video editing setup recommendation friend set fit bill perfectly loud surprisingly compact discreet sat next monitors sound normally excellent sure unfortunately bass woofer right side speaker rattling even lower volumes distinct rattle shake speaker assume transit issue mounted speakers isolation pads nothing desk cause noise louder put louder noise definitely speaker friend setup pretty much identical mine sound superb know great little monitors unfortunate mine damaged arrival not sure speak issue either listen extremely low volume find contact fact mine broken listening friend speakers nice flat frequency response deserving 1 spot top bought studio monitors amazon lists great little set speakers anything gaming podcasting av production not bluetooth enabled speakers not must list anyway hooked computer via balanced inputs taken ifi zen dac sounds superb right nice little set super compact speakers shame damage
Review: arrived damaged.. i was after a set of smaller monitors for my desktop video editing setup on a recommendation from a friend who has a set, and these fit the bill perfectly. they're loud (surprisingly so!), compact and discreet sat next to my monitors. the sound would normally be excellent i'm sure of it, but unfortunately, the bass woofer on the right side speaker is rattling, even at lower volumes, and there's a distinct rattle when you shake the speaker, so i would assume it's a transit issue. i've mounted the speakers on isolation pads and there's nothing on my desk to cause the noise and the louder you put them, the louder the noise is, so it's definitely the speaker. my friend's setup is pretty much identical to mine, and his sound superb, so i know they're great little monitors, but it's unfortunate that mine are damaged on arrival. not sure who to speak to about this issue either, so i'll just have to listen at extremely low volume for now until i can find out who to contact...other than the fact that mine are broken, listening to my friend's speakers, these have a nice flat frequency response and are deserving of their #1 spot at the top of the most bought studio monitors on the amazon lists. they're a great little set of speakers for anything from gaming, to podcasting to av production. they're not bluetooth enabled speakers, which wasn't on my must-have list anyway, but i have them hooked up to my computer via balanced inputs taken from an ifi zen dac, which sounds superb in it's own right...all in all, a nice little set of super-compact speakers. just a shame about the damage.

Review: pairs beautifully. well, it took three goes and boy; that is less than ideal...first two had issues and i think the second sub was a return if i‚Äôm being honest...the thing to watch with this kind of device, anything actively powered, the inbuilt power aspect can cause vibration. the second sub i ordered had a terrible hum which i reduced by getting the volume balanced between the eris 4.5s and the sub and the interface for my mac..the first sub just stopped producing bass; which i sent back no issue but the second sun was faulty and the return window much smaller. it went ‚Äúpop‚Äù the day the return window closed and although a bit of a pain, going back between amazon and presonus, amazon replaced the sub...third time is definitely a charm. the 4.5 and sub pair fantastically...i‚Äôm mainly working with logic pro and the clarity and depth makes production difficult because of how much fun i‚Äôm having exploring sound...the bass on this unit is deeeeeeeeeeeeep. it fills my living room and i doubt i‚Äôll ever push the unit. don‚Äôt think i need to...the bass is punchy, tight and kicks bottom...i‚Äôm sure many people have had an easier time and despite trouble getting this purchase off the ground i‚Äôm thrilled i finally did...if you‚Äôre interested in the monitor sub combo, be assured it‚Äôs great...once again, i‚Äôm using the eris 4.5 (not bt) and sub 8 and for 300 you‚Äôd be pushed to find better...frankly amazing it‚Äôs this clear and powerful at that price.

Review: no nonsense speakers with impressive sound quality. i saw these speakers on a youtuber's desk setup and he was raving about them. so i figured i'd give them a bash...i was using the built in speaker on my macbook or my monitor. both i found were similar in quality and i felt sound was ok. nothing spectacular but i felt ok given i'm not a audiophile. it gets the job done and i can listen to youtube and spotify ok...so i was curious how i would find the speakers and if i'd resent the extra space it takes on my desk. i've spent a lot of time/money making the desk as minimal as possible. so to plonk two speakers on the desk felt a little unnecessary. i didn't want to spend crazy money so these speakers seemed to fit the bill...when they arrived i carefully opened the box, unwrapped everything and plugged everything in. half convinced they'd be returned soon. i turned them on, loaded up a music video on youtube.......and boom! instantly i realised these speakers would not be going back. the sound quality is incredible! the music just came alive, i could hear so much more!..i love the styling of them, simple and understated. the front power button makes it easy for me to turn on/off without having to reach around the back...sound is not bass heavy like some headphones i've used in the past. this is important as sometimes my wife edits video so we need accuracy on the sound...i'm really struggling to think of anything negative to say so i won't!..at this price, they are an absolute steal! just get them and be happy!
Title: no nonsense speakers with impressive sound quality
Content: i saw these speakers on a youtuber's desk setup and he was raving about them. so i figured i'd give them a bash...i was using the built in speaker on my macbook or my monitor. both i found were similar in quality and i felt sound was ok. nothing spectacular but i felt ok given i'm not a audiophile. it gets the job done and i can listen to youtube and spotify ok...so i was curious how i would find the speakers and if i'd resent the extra space it takes on my desk. i've spent a lot of time/money making the desk as minimal as possible. so to plonk two speakers on the desk felt a little unnecessary. i didn't want to spend crazy money so these speakers seemed to fit the bill...when they arrived i carefully opened the box, unwrapped everything and plugged everything in. half convinced they'd be returned soon. i turned them on, loaded up a music video on youtube.......and boom! instantly i realised these speakers would not be going back. the sound quality is incredible! the music just came alive, i could hear so much more!..i love the styling of them, simple and understated. the front power button makes it easy for me to turn on/off without having to reach around the back...sound is not bass heavy like some headphones i've used in the past. this is important as sometimes my wife edits video so we need accuracy on the sound...i'm really struggling to think of anything negative to say so i won't!..at this price, they are an absolute steal! just get them and be happy!

Clean Review: good speakers reservations connected speakers pc music streaming etc opposed gaming first impressions sound pretty good speaker size good bass without overwhelming increased bass slightly slightly worried buying need buy separate cable connect pc proved not case everything included though instructions not see things improved 1 perhaps not best looking speakers first thought bit boxy square changed mind quite like chunkiness however desktop set better angled upwards 2 volume control not markings not tell far turned apart sound better visual marker 3 bass treble controls reason presonus not refer bass treble terms everyone understands awkwardly located back left speaker 4 documentation pretty poor startup guide user guide neither box register product get no help anyone no specialist audio skills hooking pc not show terminology fine sound engineers dedicated gamers not average pc user look online tutorials take step step small reservations aside happy
Review: good speakers with a few reservations. i've only just connected these speakers to my pc (for music, streaming, etc as opposed to gaming) so these are my first impressions...the sound is pretty good for the speaker size. there is good bass without it being overwhelming (i've increased the bass slightly). i was slightly worried before buying them that i might need to buy a separate cable to connect to my pc, but this proved not to be the case - everything was included (though the instructions were not - see below)...there are a few things that could be improved on:..1. perhaps they are not the best looking speakers - at first i thought there were a bit "boxy" and square, but i've changed my mind and quite like their chunkiness. however, for a desktop set up it would be better to have them angled upwards...2. the volume control doesn't have any markings so you can't tell how far you've turned it apart from the sound - it would be better to have a visual marker...3. bass and treble controls (for some reason presonus don't refer to them as bass and treble which are terms everyone understands!) are awkwardly located at the back of the left speaker...4. documentation is pretty poor. the startup guide and user guide (neither of which were in the box - i had to register the product to get them) is no help for anyone with no specialist audio skills just hooking up to a pc: it doesn't show how to do this, and the terminology might be fine for sound engineers and dedicated gamers but not for your average pc user. i had to look for online tutorials to take me through it step by step...these small reservations aside, i'm very happy with them.
Title: good speakers with a few reservations

Review: adds the boom boom.. bought to complement a set of desktop eris e3.5 speakers...this sub hits hard and is very loud. i had to turn the gain all the way down and it's still borderline too loud sometimes. resolved the issue by turning the overall system output volume down and turning the speaker gain up to compensate...i'd recommend connecting the sub / speakers with y-splitters from your source rather than in series, i encountered a ground loop when connected that way.

Clean Review: excellent speakers price really good reference speakers highs mids really clear bass present nice tight bass compliments speakers instead drowning everything basically get put speakers upgrade wires connectors instead comes box boy speakers respond hear supposed speakers bass mix tight bass get likewise little no bass mix not hear strong speakers not colour sound faithfully reproduce whatever main music source size price point excellent speakers highly recommend
Review: excellent speakers for the price!. these are really good reference speakers, the highs and mids are really clear and the bass is present, but nice and tight, the bass compliments the speakers instead of drowning everything out...basically you get what you put into these speakers, upgrade your wires and connectors, instead of what comes in the box, and boy do these speakers respond!..you hear what you're supposed to with these speakers, if there's bass in the mix then tight bass is what you get, likewise if there's little to no bass in your mix then you won't hear it as strong, these speakers do not 'colour' your sound, they faithfully reproduce whatever your main music source is...for the size and the price point they are excellent speakers..i would highly recommend them!

Clean Review: excellent sound price tolerate ever present quiet hiss constant hiss coming speakers not particularly loud present regardless volume turned way not around 70 volume hiss gets louder not affected adjustments volume source pc hiss still present even no cables power attached said not know whether normal pair speakers like upgraded pair creative gigaworks t40 speakers noticeable hum hiss 50 volume hiss presonus eris e4 5 bt speakers much quieter took 3 days even notice sensitive considered annoying noises not consider hiss particularly obnoxious annoying fact tinnitus almost comforting not dealbreaker still something potential buyers may wish know consider committing purchasing speakers quality audio speakers really huge step aforementioned creative t40s seemed first not much bass turning low end frequencies acoustic tuning controls say confidence speakers produce ample amounts bass keep mind adjusting controls defeat point using speakers reference monitors since certain frequencies become enhanced stifled depending set overall great pair speakers marred quiet hiss find impossible not notice not dealbreaker though still satisfied price
Review: excellent sound for the price if you can tolerate an ever-present quiet hiss. there is a constant hiss coming from the speakers. it is not particularly loud but it is present regardless of if the volume is turned all the way down or not, and above around 70% volume the hiss gets louder. it is not affected by any adjustments to volume from the source (pc) and the hiss is still present even when there are no cables other than the power attached...that being said, i do not know whether this is normal for a pair of speakers like this. i upgraded from a pair of creative gigaworks t40 speakers, which had a noticeable hum and hiss above 50% volume. this hiss from these presonus eris e4.5 bt speakers is much quieter and it took me about 3 days to even notice it. i am sensitive to what might be considered to be annoying noises, but i do not consider the hiss to be particularly obnoxious or annoying - in fact, with my tinnitus it is almost comforting. it's not a dealbreaker for me, but this is still something potential buyers may wish to know and consider before committing to purchasing these speakers...as for the quality of the audio from these speakers, they really are a huge step up from the aforementioned creative t40s. it seemed at first that there wasn't much bass, but after turning up the low end frequencies on the acoustic tuning controls i can say with confidence that these speakers can produce ample amounts of bass. just keep in mind that adjusting these controls can defeat the point of using the speakers as reference monitors since certain frequencies will become enhanced or stifled depending on how you set them...overall a great pair of speakers, only marred by the quiet hiss that i now find impossible not to notice. not a dealbreaker for me, though, and i'm still satisfied with them for the price.

Clean Review: great subwoofer however needs slight modification good sounding subwoofer works nicely eris 3 5 speakers however noticed fairly loud humming noise coming transformer transformers make noise nature however quite loud sub believe caused transformer vibrations resonating case sub due poor mount case transformer reading review also mentioning ended mounting transformer anti vibration washers using cable ties support sub silent warning attempt ok voiding warranty device
Review: great subwoofer, however needs slight modification. good sounding subwoofer, works nicely with the eris 3.5 speakers. however i noticed there was a fairly loud humming noise coming from the transformer...transformers make noise by nature however it was quite loud in this sub. i believe it was being caused from the transformer vibrations resonating through the case of the sub due to a poor mount between the case and the transformer...after reading a review also mentioning this i ended up re-mounting the transformer with some anti vibration washers then using some cable ties to support it. after doing this, the sub is now silent...warning only attempt this if you are ok with voiding the warranty on this device.

Clean Review: good clarity vocals even bass sound better expected lots research got two sets consideration edifier r1700bt many video reviews careful listening preferred bass sounded edifier r1700bt rest sounded little muddy presonus eris e4 5 sound clear lacked bass sound edifier r1700bt produced hard tell sure via youtube review headset sure perfect world liked two desk review goes bass sound better presonus eris e4 5 expecting happy choice spend time positioning seating positioning find sweet spot not disappointed get decent foam pads seat desk get unwanted vibrations like pc enclosed confined space eq acoustics premium acoustic foam tiles help unwanted echo reverberation important audio mixing recordings play games
Review: very good clarity, vocals and even bass sound better than expected. after lots of research got it down to two sets for consideration, these and the edifier r1700bt, after many video reviews and careful listening, i preferred how the bass sounded on the edifier r1700bt, but the rest sounded a little muddy, the presonus eris e4.5 sound more clear but lacked the same bass sound the edifier r1700bt produced, hard to tell for sure via youtube review over your own headset for sure, perfect world would have liked to had the two on my desk to review, but as it goes the bass sound better on the presonus eris e4.5 than i was expecting so more than happy with my choice, just spend some time positioning them and you seating positioning to find that sweet spot and you won't be disappointed...get some decent foam pads to seat them on as on your desk you will get unwanted vibrations, and if like me you have you pc in a enclosed confined space then some eq acoustics premium acoustic foam tiles will help with unwanted echo and reverberation, more important if you do audio mixing or recordings than if you just play games.
Title: very good clarity, vocals and even bass sound better than expected
Content: after lots of research got it down to two sets for consideration, these and the edifier r1700bt, after many video reviews and careful listening, i preferred how the bass sounded on the edifier r1700bt, but the rest sounded a little muddy, the presonus eris e4.5 sound more clear but lacked the same bass sound the edifier r1700bt produced, hard to tell for sure via youtube review over your own headset for sure, perfect world would have liked to had the two on my desk to review, but as it goes the bass sound better on the presonus eris e4.5 than i was expecting so more than happy with my choice, just spend some time positioning them and you seating positioning to find that sweet spot and you won't be disappointed...get some decent foam pads to seat them on as on your desk you will get unwanted vibrations, and if like me you have you pc in a enclosed confined space then some eq acoustics premium acoustic foam tiles will help with unwanted echo and reverberation, more important if you do audio mixing or recordings than if you just play games.

Clean Review: amazing price quality ratio not expecting much price although glowing reviews hinted good potential sound absolutely fantastic not tried mixing yet general listening compare favourably pair rokits long time bearing mind obvious difference woofer size sound clear natural still punchy without overbearing frequencies perhaps bit tight overall expect mellow cones break excellent small footprint desk well overall absolute steal head shoulders typical pc speakers not much money
Review: amazing price/quality ratio. i wasn't expecting much for the price (although the glowing reviews hinted at some good potential), but these sound absolutely fantastic. i haven't tried them for mixing yet, but for general listening they compare very, very favourably to a pair of rokits i had for a long time (bearing in mind the obvious difference in woofer size). they just sound clear, natural but still punchy. without any overbearing frequencies. perhaps a bit tight overall, but i would expect that to mellow out as the cones break in. excellent small footprint on a desk as well. overall, these are an absolute steal, and are head and shoulders above your typical pc speakers for not that much more money.
Title: amazing price/quality ratio
Content: i wasn't expecting much for the price (although the glowing reviews hinted at some good potential), but these sound absolutely fantastic. i haven't tried them for mixing yet, but for general listening they compare very, very favourably to a pair of rokits i had for a long time (bearing in mind the obvious difference in woofer size). they just sound clear, natural but still punchy. without any overbearing frequencies. perhaps a bit tight overall, but i would expect that to mellow out as the cones break in. excellent small footprint on a desk as well. overall, these are an absolute steal, and are head and shoulders above your typical pc speakers for not that much more money.

Clean Review: great desktop speakers clear sparkling reproduction music much deliberation bought office work listen music lower levels not low workforce gone home quite bit research quite recommendations next option level considering double price overall im happy lack bit low end find audioengine a2 smaller quite bit punch low end however not image nearly well mid top end much better imo im playing fiio dac build quality ok plastic enclosures feel bit light cheap weigh bit heavy ornaments top buy money want bit bass perhaps looks elsewhere turn eq controls
Review: great desktop speakers for a clear sparkling reproduction of music. after much deliberation i bought these for my office at work to listen to music at lower levels (and not so low when most of the workforce has gone home). i did quite a bit of research and there were quite a few recommendations for these. the next option level up i was considering were over double the price...overall im very happy with them, they do lack a bit of low end, i find the audioengine a2's i have at some while smaller have quite a bit more punch and low end, however, they don't image nearly as well as these and the mid and top end is much better with these imo. im playing these through a fiio dac...build quality is ok. they are plastic enclosures which feel a bit light and cheap to me, but i just weigh them down a bit with some heavy ornaments on top of them...i would buy them again for the money, but if you want a bit of bass then perhaps looks elsewhere (or turn it up with the eq controls).

Review: very pure sound. early days but so far i am very impressed but with reservations. it appears that for a number of people they have stopped working within 2 years. someone commented that there is a power chip with a heatsink that gets very hot which could be the cause. with this in mind i took out the 3 year insurance from amazon, which knowing my luck probably means they will go wrong after that runs out. however, the pureness of the sound is excellent. for a number of years manufacturers have produced sound systems with heavy bass, great if you're into head banging but a nightmare if you actually want to listen to the nuances. for the size these deliver remarkable clarity.

Clean Review: probably best speakers less 100 quite like speakers not usual drowned mids artificial bass boost bookshelf speakers instead trying faithful source think perform fairly well music listening movies videogames still give lot information want music production not bad considering tiny 3 5 speakers get saving lot space desk apart sounding great pack nice features not easy find category things like optional trs outputs kevlar woofer aux headphones ports really make eris 3 5 stand budget speakers two eq knobs back fixing audio space related issues also welcome addition know much ask price included pads bit thicker also missing auto power saving mode like krk least option turn power led went 3 5 really wanted smaller possible obviously come limitations comes sound especially lower frequencies strongly suggest looking 4 5 ones bigger space not issue used exclusively music production nutshell want small speakers budget still stay relatively accurate sound great probably best bet
Review: probably the best speakers for less than ¬£100.. i quite like these speakers. they are not your usual drowned mids/artificial bass boost bookshelf speakers., instead they are trying to be faithful to the source. i think they perform fairly well both for music listening and movies/videogames, while they still give you a lot of information if you want to do some music production. not bad at all, considering they are as tiny as 3.5" speakers can get, saving you a lot of space on your desk...apart from sounding great, they pack some nice features that are not that easy to find at this category. things like optional trs outputs, kevlar woofer, aux-in and headphones ports really make the eris 3.5 stand out from most budget speakers. the two eq knobs on the back for fixing some audio space related issues are also a welcome addition...i know it might be much to ask at this price, but the included pads could be a bit thicker. i am also missing an auto power-saving mode like the krk's, or at least an option to turn off the power led. i went for the 3.5'' because i really wanted the smaller possible, but they obviously come with some limitations when it comes to sound, especially on the lower frequencies. i would strongly suggest looking at the 4.5" ones (or bigger) if space is not an issue or if they are to be used exclusively for music production...in a nutshell, if you want small speakers on a budget that still stay relatively accurate and sound great, this is probably your best bet.
Title: probably the best speakers for less than ¬£100.
Content: i quite like these speakers. they are not your usual drowned mids/artificial bass boost bookshelf speakers., instead they are trying to be faithful to the source. i think they perform fairly well both for music listening and movies/videogames, while they still give you a lot of information if you want to do some music production. not bad at all, considering they are as tiny as 3.5" speakers can get, saving you a lot of space on your desk...apart from sounding great, they pack some nice features that are not that easy to find at this category. things like optional trs outputs, kevlar woofer, aux-in and headphones ports really make the eris 3.5 stand out from most budget speakers. the two eq knobs on the back for fixing some audio space related issues are also a welcome addition...i know it might be much to ask at this price, but the included pads could be a bit thicker. i am also missing an auto power-saving mode like the krk's, or at least an option to turn off the power led. i went for the 3.5'' because i really wanted the smaller possible, but they obviously come with some limitations when it comes to sound, especially on the lower frequencies. i would strongly suggest looking at the 4.5" ones (or bigger) if space is not an issue or if they are to be used exclusively for music production...in a nutshell, if you want small speakers on a budget that still stay relatively accurate and sound great, this is probably your best bet.

Review: great pair of speakers. presonus eris e4.5..arrive in a nice box with a power lead, small jack to phono (which is typically what you need to connect them to a pc or portable device), and a length of speak wire to connect the two speakers together. i didn‚Äôt measure any of the leads but most of them are about 1.5m and the speaker wire is about 1.8m. the speaker wire is nothing special, no propitiatory plugs on the end, so easy to replace if you need something longer...i bought these as a pair of computer speakers. having tried a number of different makes, i wanted something that didn‚Äôt mess with the sound so much. these are just great. very neutral. of course they are best for music. with games, it really doesn‚Äôt matter much what speakers you use, they all sound pretty good. who knows what the game is supposed to sound like anyway? with movies and so on, they sound good but i generally find that any source on the internet sounds ‚Äúnot that great‚Äù and the speakers are capable of something more...i like the addition of a mains switch on the front, volume control, led and a few sockets for input (aux) and output (headphones). it‚Äôs particularly useful to be able to set the max volume on the knob and just leave it alone ‚Äì using the computer volume from there on. the led is relatively dim so unobtrusive, especially from any other angle other that dead on...the speakers use eight watts doing nothing and mine refused to go in to standby mode. i sat there for two hours and nothing. now i know that eight watts is not much but my speakers needed to be on twenty four hours a day which adds up to seventy kilowatt hours per year. that's hopeless. i don't want to deduct a star for that but just be warned, you really need to turn them off! some people complained about the standby so perhaps they have disabled it now? don't know. couldn't find any information about that...i compared these directly to a pair of edifier, and i have to say that the edifier were probably better for most people. they were more liv

Review: vast improvement on cheap pc speakers. my logitech z506 5.1 pc sound system served me well for a decade but finally decided to stop working. as a temporary measure i set up the dell pc speakers that had come with the system, and was shocked at how bad they were were! i was about to buy the z607 speaker system, as being the nearest direct replacement to the z506, when i spotted a recommendation on the internet to try the presonus eris e3.5 instead. i was a bit dubious about "downgrading" to just stereo speakers, but i had long stopped using the rear speakers of the z506 as they didn't give true surround sound and locating them correctly and running the wires safely was always a problem. also, i rarely had the subwoofer turned up that rapidly gained complaints from the rest of the family! anyway, the eris speakers are very easy to setup, the sound is as good - if not better - than the old z506, and general setup is tidier, with no sub-woofer or centre speaker. if you are demanding music connoisseur or have a high-end gaming rig then look else where, but for the average home user looking for a simple solution that will provide decent but not exceptional sound at a relatively low price - definitely an option to consider seriously.
Title: vast improvement on cheap pc speakers
Content: my logitech z506 5.1 pc sound system served me well for a decade but finally decided to stop working. as a temporary measure i set up the dell pc speakers that had come with the system, and was shocked at how bad they were were! i was about to buy the z607 speaker system, as being the nearest direct replacement to the z506, when i spotted a recommendation on the internet to try the presonus eris e3.5 instead. i was a bit dubious about "downgrading" to just stereo speakers, but i had long stopped using the rear speakers of the z506 as they didn't give true surround sound and locating them correctly and running the wires safely was always a problem. also, i rarely had the subwoofer turned up that rapidly gained complaints from the rest of the family! anyway, the eris speakers are very easy to setup, the sound is as good - if not better - than the old z506, and general setup is tidier, with no sub-woofer or centre speaker. if you are demanding music connoisseur or have a high-end gaming rig then look else where, but for the average home user looking for a simple solution that will provide decent but not exceptional sound at a relatively low price - definitely an option to consider seriously.

Clean Review: excellent value money audiophile review think cheapest single bit audio equipment wanted something use desktop monitoring guitar playing without breaking bank 600 hifi setup good iem open back headphones things considered think really good value money resolution ability reproduce detail music good money not able discern lossy vs lossless music not even close however hold detail midrange pretty good high end clarity lost little money not expect much range frequencies well 3 inch monitors course wont produce floor shaking sub bass example billy eilish power sub bass wubwub bits starting 2 45 barely audible least no weight sound tuning seems pretty flat frequencies produces however course nowhere near full range sound discussed lacks majority bass 60hz soundstage imaging ability place certain sounds space front back left right fairly poor narrow however expected something relly get much expensive speakers front back imaging falls isnt much depth soundstage either must reiterate not expect 89 power volume enough kind small medium room desktop listening designed not hifi system room filling sound perfect desktop use connectivity excellent whole range options personally run audiointerface back using rca trs works fine idea powered slave speaker makes sense price build quality great not really ask 89 honestly quite impressive
Review: excellent value for money - audiophile review. so i think these are the cheapest single bit of audio equipment i own. i wanted something to use at my desktop for monitoring my guitar playing without breaking the bank...i have a ¬£600 hifi setup, good iem's and open back headphones, and all things considered i think these are really good value for money...resolution (ability for them to reproduce detail in music).- good (for the money). you won't be able to discern lossy vs lossless music with these. not even close. however they hold their own. the detail in the midrange is pretty good. high end clarity is lost a little. for the money, i'd not expect much more than this...range of frequencies.- well, they're 3-inch monitors. of course they wont produce floor shaking sub-bass. for example in billy eilish - your power. the sub bass wubwub bits starting at 2.45 are barely audible, or at least there is no weight to the sound at all...tuning.- it seems pretty 'flat' to me for the frequencies it produces, however, of course this is nowhere near a full-range sound (as discussed above) so it lacks the majority of bass below 60hz...soundstage and imaging (the ability for them to place certain sounds in space - front, back, left, right, up, down).- is fairly poor, narrow, however to be expected. this is something you only relly get with much more expensive speakers.- front/back and up/down imaging is where it falls off. there isnt much depth to the soundstage either. again, i must reiterate i wouldn't expect this at ¬£89...power (volume).- more than enough for any kind of small-medium room desktop listening which this is designed for. not a hifi system / room filling sound. but perfect for desktop use...connectivity.- excellent. whole range of options. personally i run from my audiointerface into the back using rca or trs and it works just fine. the idea of a powered and slave speaker makes more sense at this price...build quality.- great. i wouldn't really ask for any more than this at ¬£89. it's honestly quite impressive. t
Title: excellent value for money - audiophile review
Content: so i think these are the cheapest single bit of audio equipment i own. i wanted something to use at my desktop for monitoring my guitar playing without breaking the bank...i have a ¬£600 hifi setup, good iem's and open back headphones, and all things considered i think these are really good value for money...resolution (ability for them to reproduce detail in music).- good (for the money). you won't be able to discern lossy vs lossless music with these. not even close. however they hold their own. the detail in the midrange is pretty good. high end clarity is lost a little. for the money, i'd not expect much more than this...range of frequencies.- well, they're 3-inch monitors. of course they wont produce floor shaking sub-bass. for example in billy eilish - your power. the sub bass wubwub bits starting at 2.45 are barely audible, or at least there is no weight to the sound at all...tuning.- it seems pretty 'flat' to me for the frequencies it produces, however, of course this is nowhere near a full-range sound (as discussed above) so it lacks the majority of bass below 60hz...soundstage and imaging (the ability for them to place certain sounds in space - front, back, left, right, up, down).- is fairly poor, narrow, however to be expected. this is something you only relly get with much more expensive speakers.- front/back and up/down imaging is where it falls off. there isnt much depth to the soundstage either. again, i must reiterate i wouldn't expect this at ¬£89...power (volume).- more than enough for any kind of small-medium room desktop listening which this is designed for. not a hifi system / room filling sound. but perfect for desktop use...connectivity.- excellent. whole range of options. personally i run from my audiointerface into the back using rca or trs and it works just fine. the idea of a powered and slave speaker makes more sense at this price...build quality.- great. i wouldn't really ask for any more than this at ¬£89. it's honestly quite impressive. t

Clean Review: fantastic multimedia gaming speakers bought replace set creative gigaworks t40 ii creative t100 felt something missing sound looked monitor speakers discounted not audiophile like good sound speakers spades soon swapped old speakers desk amazed much clearer well better defined sound although dabble bit midi controller virtual instruments sometimes not musician see use people create music computer surprising thing price around price gigaworks t40 ii bought cheaper creative t100s although keep hold t40s spare set getting rid t100s never satisfied price set excellent value tried games well hear footsteps voices around buildings fps games heard via headphones never heard speakers clearly sum pleased
Review: fantastic multimedia and gaming speakers. i bought those to replace a set of creative gigaworks t40 ii's and creative t100's as i felt something was missing from the sound so i looked at those monitor speakers as they were discounted...i'm not an audiophile but i do like good sound and these speakers have it in spades. as soon as i swapped my old speakers off my desk, i was amazed by how much clearer and well better defined the sound was...although i dabble a bit with a midi controller with virtual instruments sometimes, i'm not a musician but i can see those being of use to some people who do create music on computer...the most surprising thing of all was the price, they were around the same price as the gigaworks t40 ii's when i bought them and cheaper than the creative t100s. although i'll keep a hold of the t40s as a spare set, i'll be getting rid of the t100s as i was never satisfied with them. for the price, this set are excellent value...i've tried them in games as well, i can hear footsteps and voices around buildings in some fps games that i've heard via headphones but never heard before on speakers so clearly. to sum it up, i'm very pleased with them!
Title: fantastic multimedia and gaming speakers
Content: i bought those to replace a set of creative gigaworks t40 ii's and creative t100's as i felt something was missing from the sound so i looked at those monitor speakers as they were discounted...i'm not an audiophile but i do like good sound and these speakers have it in spades. as soon as i swapped my old speakers off my desk, i was amazed by how much clearer and well better defined the sound was...although i dabble a bit with a midi controller with virtual instruments sometimes, i'm not a musician but i can see those being of use to some people who do create music on computer...the most surprising thing of all was the price, they were around the same price as the gigaworks t40 ii's when i bought them and cheaper than the creative t100s. although i'll keep a hold of the t40s as a spare set, i'll be getting rid of the t100s as i was never satisfied with them. for the price, this set are excellent value...i've tried them in games as well, i can hear footsteps and voices around buildings in some fps games that i've heard via headphones but never heard before on speakers so clearly. to sum it up, i'm very pleased with them!

Review: utter bargain. i recently got back in music creation and bought a daw. up until then i relied on headphones which were great. but then i read it's best to have a 2nd reference, ie audio monitors for checking levels and such..didn't want to spend too much in case it became another one of many fads..i'm driving these with a presonus 24c audio interface, wired with singles trs cables instead of the rca cable they provide..for the money they sound pretty darn good, and loud too. the pack a lot of punch for there size and double up as great gaming speakers...the icing on the cake for me was buying a used/returned pair off amazon marketplace for ¬£66. they were described as having a deep scratch but when i checked them over. nothing, immaculate.

Review: solid set of speakers. bought these to replace a set of mackie cr4's which had started to give up after 6 years of light use - hoping these last a bit longer...easy set-up - the active speaker is the left one - which didn't work for me so had to reverse the inputs to make it the right one. useful to have the power and volume adjustment on the front. volume control very linear...i am no expert but these do sound great, a step up form the mackie's - i have zero hum and clarity is great up to the moderate volumes i listen at.

Review: presonus, great as always. for ¬£150, the eris sub8 is great value for money. i'm a big fan of presonus gear, and once again i am impressed. for me, one of the great things is the trs connectivity, making it very easy to connect to your audio interface and your monitors. there are also numerous settings on the amp to tweak the sound to your liking. there is a bit of a noise floor, but it isn't too significant. i would definitely recommend this subwoofer to anyone looking for a budget option that still sounds great.

Clean Review: presonus eris sub8 compact gorgeous looks average performance positive reviews product much looking forward hooking sub system however first disappointed sound quality general not deliver window rattling lound punchy low end base like reviewers suggested said addition sub actually drastically improve overall low end frequencies paired somewhat base shy presonus e3 5 satellite speakers reason recommend sub please not expect ear shatteringly loud punchy low end base not get system hooked pc small office space 5 x10 mainly play music need sub speakers set almost max hpf 180 deg swithes located rear unit make no difference sound whatsoever little disappointing volume control also located back people may also find tad inconvenient shocked playing sub satellite speakers turned lower frequency base notes sounded not quiet muffled distorted hoping nice loud punchy low end base not get said played together satellite speakers overall sound seem come life not put review overall sound pretty good money usually true say get pay
Review: presonus eris sub8 compact with gorgeous looks & average performance!. after all the positive reviews about this product, i was so much looking forward to hooking this sub up to my system. however, i was at first very disappointed with the sound quality in general, because it did not deliver the window rattling, lound, punchy, low-end base like some other reviewers had suggested it did! having said that, the addition of this sub will actually drastically improve the overall low end frequencies when paired with the somewhat base-shy presonus e3.5 satellite speakers. for this reason i have to recommend this sub, but please don't expect ear shatteringly loud, punchy low end base because you won't get it! i have my system hooked up to my pc in a small office space just 5'x10' & mainly play music and i need both the sub & speakers set to almost max!.both hpf & 180 deg. swithes located on the rear of the unit make no difference to the sound whatsoever which is a little disappointing & the volume control is also located on the back which some people may also find a tad inconvenient..i was shocked when playing just the sub on its own (satellite speakers turned off) because the lower frequency base notes sounded not only very quiet, but muffled & distorted too! i was hoping for nice loud punchy low end base but didn't get it! having said that - when played together with the satellite speakers the overall sound does seem to come life!.don't be put off by this review because the overall sound is pretty good for the money & its usually true in what they say - "you get what you pay for"!
Title: presonus eris sub8 compact with gorgeous looks & average performance!
Content: after all the positive reviews about this product, i was so much looking forward to hooking this sub up to my system. however, i was at first very disappointed with the sound quality in general, because it did not deliver the window rattling, lound, punchy, low-end base like some other reviewers had suggested it did! having said that, the addition of this sub will actually drastically improve the overall low end frequencies when paired with the somewhat base-shy presonus e3.5 satellite speakers. for this reason i have to recommend this sub, but please don't expect ear shatteringly loud, punchy low end base because you won't get it! i have my system hooked up to my pc in a small office space just 5'x10' & mainly play music and i need both the sub & speakers set to almost max!.both hpf & 180 deg. swithes located on the rear of the unit make no difference to the sound whatsoever which is a little disappointing & the volume control is also located on the back which some people may also find a tad inconvenient..i was shocked when playing just the sub on its own (satellite speakers turned off) because the lower frequency base notes sounded not only very quiet, but muffled & distorted too! i was hoping for nice loud punchy low end base but didn't get it! having said that - when played together with the satellite speakers the overall sound does seem to come life!.don't be put off by this review because the overall sound is pretty good for the money & its usually true in what they say - "you get what you pay for"!

Clean Review: good speakers price look nice built well cables fairly long little longer long enough desks volume go loud without losing much quality louder ever need meant music people want hear things accurately means music production pretty good things voices practically sound bit okay gaming good bass good sound quality although things sound little things not noticeable not listing though also angle sound straight mean directly front speakers loud step side notice drop volume sound obvious noticeable speakers used think pretty good price good using electric instruments music production
Review: good speakers for the price. these look nice and are built well...the cables are fairly long. could be a little longer but long enough for most desks...the volume can go very loud without losing too much quality. louder than i will ever need...these are meant more for music people who want to hear things more accurately. this means that for music production the are pretty good but some things and voices in practically sound a bit off...they are okay for gaming as they have good bass and good sound quality although again, some things do sound a little off...most of these things are not that noticeable if you are not listing out for it though...they also angle sound very "straight". by this i mean if you are directly in front of the speakers they are very loud but if you step to the side you can notice a drop in volume. sound obvious but its more noticeable than with other speakers that i have used...all in all i think they are pretty good for the price and very good if you are using them for electric instruments or music production.
Title: good speakers for the price
Content: these look nice and are built well...the cables are fairly long. could be a little longer but long enough for most desks...the volume can go very loud without losing too much quality. louder than i will ever need...these are meant more for music people who want to hear things more accurately. this means that for music production the are pretty good but some things and voices in practically sound a bit off...they are okay for gaming as they have good bass and good sound quality although again, some things do sound a little off...most of these things are not that noticeable if you are not listing out for it though...they also angle sound very "straight". by this i mean if you are directly in front of the speakers they are very loud but if you step to the side you can notice a drop in volume. sound obvious but its more noticeable than with other speakers that i have used...all in all i think they are pretty good for the price and very good if you are using them for electric instruments or music production.

Clean Review: real review like small compact yet powerful set speakers used small room really good however something bit kick slightly larger room probably go 4 5 inch version 3 5 inch version really lack bass love 3 5 inch version speakers lack volume not go loud recording low volume daw software playback lack volume desire sound quality good though update week broken fuzzy noise coming left cone certain bass frequency hit sounds garbage
Review: a real review. if you would like a small compact yet powerful set of speakers to be used in a small room, these are really good. however, if you're after something with a bit more kick in a slightly larger room then you should probably go for the 4.5 inch version as the 3.5 inch version really lack bass. i love the 3.5 inch version of the speakers but it does lack volume, they don't go very loud so if you're recording at low volume in your daw software playback will lack the volume that you so desire. the sound quality is good though...update:.just under a week and they're broken, there's a fuzzy noise coming from the left cone when a certain bass frequency has hit and it sounds garbage now!!!!

Review: outstanding for the price. it‚Äôs been stated in other reviews that these speakers punch way above their price and size. i agree...the sound from the speakers is big and open. the tweeters provide really great rendition on all sorts of cymbals and the set up picks up all guitars, pianos, violins and cellos, brass, reed and vocals and provides a remarkably authentic, clipping free level of fidelity for their price and size...if they have a failing, it‚Äôs in low end bass. anyone expecting too much of that from a 3.5‚Äù mid/bass, may be somewhat optimistic...i matched these units with an existing sub unit and the overall sound quality is outstanding for the price. the 3.5s bottom out at 80hz. bear that in mind. on their own they are superior to many desktop speakers, but you need a sub if you want a full ‚Äòsound stage‚Äô...there was some buzzing on install. the supplied cables are - adequate. i thought i might have to invest in some better (shielded) ones. however, judicious positioning of the power and input cables solved the problem...would i recommend these? yes. i don‚Äôt know what comes near them at their price.
Title: outstanding for the price
Content: it‚Äôs been stated in other reviews that these speakers punch way above their price and size. i agree...the sound from the speakers is big and open. the tweeters provide really great rendition on all sorts of cymbals and the set up picks up all guitars, pianos, violins and cellos, brass, reed and vocals and provides a remarkably authentic, clipping free level of fidelity for their price and size...if they have a failing, it‚Äôs in low end bass. anyone expecting too much of that from a 3.5‚Äù mid/bass, may be somewhat optimistic...i matched these units with an existing sub unit and the overall sound quality is outstanding for the price. the 3.5s bottom out at 80hz. bear that in mind. on their own they are superior to many desktop speakers, but you need a sub if you want a full ‚Äòsound stage‚Äô...there was some buzzing on install. the supplied cables are - adequate. i thought i might have to invest in some better (shielded) ones. however, judicious positioning of the power and input cables solved the problem...would i recommend these? yes. i don‚Äôt know what comes near them at their price.

Clean Review: really good price firstly point get absolutely no mains hum whatsoever studio monitors sensitive massive problems adams caused duff mains adaptor usually either leads devices plugged mains block possible give socket lamps trouble socket tv seems fine block upgrading interconnect cables also helps lot mine 50 quid overkill 20 30 supplied ones really low end sub 5 pound cables not speakers justice got upgrade pioneer dm40s set adam audio studio monitors upstairs everytime listened lounge found sound good underwhelming connected tv use tv music much immersive higher clarity pioneers soundstage comes much like separate bass treble controls tweak sound music videos come life not good adams extra 100 bigger professional 160 paid great treble clear sound lively fun bass good size speaker good relatively small lounge rear ported keep away walls cover ports not possible
Review: really good for the price. firstly i'll point out i get absolutely no mains hum from these whatsoever but studio monitors are sensitive to it. i had massive problems with my adams caused by a duff mains adaptor. it'll usually be either from the leads or other devices plugged into same mains block. if possible give these they're own socket. lamps can be trouble if in same socket. tv seems fine in same block. upgrading interconnect cables also helps a lot. mine are 50 quid and that's overkill but 20 or 30 should do. the supplied ones are really low end sub 5 pound cables and don't do the speakers justice. got these as an upgrade from the pioneer dm40s. i have a set of adam audio studio monitors upstairs and everytime i listened in my lounge i found the sound good but underwhelming. have these connected up to the tv and use for tv and music. they are much more immersive and higher clarity than the pioneers. soundstage comes out much further. like having separate bass and treble controls too to tweak the sound. music videos come to life. they're not as good as the adams but they are an extra 100 and bigger too and more professional. for 160 i paid for these they are great. treble is clear, sound is lively and fun. bass is good for the size of the speaker. good in my relatively small lounge. rear ported so keep away from walls or cover the ports if that's not possible .

Review: lightweight build quality. bought from amazon warehouse as none in stock at the time, i was disappointed to find no instructions or software as advertised . more alarming was the lightweight build quality that has a hollow ring to it when you tap the cabinet. i was not expecting great things, but i was wrong (mostly).there is plenty of power for nearfield monitoring and it digs deep keeping the notes tuneful and tight, no flabbiness at all. i was impressed! if only it didn't look and feel like a cheap imitation of the real thing it would have got 5 stars. i also would like the power light to go out or at least blink when it enters standby.

Review: packs a punch. so after doing lots of research and countless videos on budget monitor speakers it was a choice between these and a few other speakers within the same price range. i decided to purchase these speakers and i must say im very impressed! i wanted some speakers for music production and djing but was a little apprehensive as i heard the bass on these are not as deep as the others and i am very much a person who loves my bass. these speakers pack a punch and carry a good bass, obviously you want get a deep ground rumbling bass but it does have enough bass to hear and feel and great clarity which is a must when producing music. they are also surprisingly loud, louder than i expected. the bass does get a bit distorted when cranked right up which is to be expected. the sound easily fills the room and is ideal if your a bedroom producer/dj or to just play songs on.

Clean Review: great works best equaliser box speakers pretty bass heavy muffled low mid sound left dialogue footsteps feeling muted explosions music dominant knobs back adjust treble bass much not lot however use pc applying equaliser like dolby atoms balance highs mids lows get best speakers adjusted speakers ability produce clear highs lows albeit lows still heard overall 4 5 price build quality noise quality
Review: great but works best with an equaliser.... out of the box, the speakers are pretty bass heavy and have a muffled low/mid sound. it left dialogue and footsteps feeling very muted but explosions and any music very dominant. the knobs on the back to adjust the treble and bass only do so much (not a lot)...however as i use them with a pc, applying an equaliser like dolby atoms, you can balance out the highs, mids and lows to get the best out of these speakers...once adjusted the speakers have the ability to produce clear highs and lows, albeit the lows can still be heard more...overall 4/5 for price, build quality and noise quality.
Title: great but works best with an equaliser...
Content: out of the box, the speakers are pretty bass heavy and have a muffled low/mid sound. it left dialogue and footsteps feeling very muted but explosions and any music very dominant. the knobs on the back to adjust the treble and bass only do so much (not a lot)...however as i use them with a pc, applying an equaliser like dolby atoms, you can balance out the highs, mids and lows to get the best out of these speakers...once adjusted the speakers have the ability to produce clear highs and lows, albeit the lows can still be heard more...overall 4/5 for price, build quality and noise quality.

Review: unusable due to missing cables and not being able to download the drivers. bought these from amazon for a christmas present for my son. however, on christmas day he found the cables were missing. contacted amazon who offered a small discount so i could then purchase the missing cables which i bought from amazon. these arrived today and he was able to set the speakers up to then find that he couldn't download the necessary drivers and software because when he tried to register the product they had previously been registered to someone else making them not fit for purpose. amazon have offered a refund however the price has increased from the price i paid for them so in order to replace them i will have to shell out more money on top of the additional amount i've spent on cables which we no longer need. i've always been happy with purchases and service i've received from amazon but this christmas i have encountered several problem with item purchased. this was the biggest disappointment of them all and has caused one headache after another trying to resolve it with several different chat assistants.
