Clean Review: small home studio requires edm artist like tracks plenty low end 3 7 monitor speakers fail provide deep sub bass reproduction dedicated sub always needed monitor low frequencies headphones get part way still miss valuable frequencies true sub bass felt instead heard impressed impact small unit drives body blows sub bass straight gut really fills gap frequencies speeded workflow tremendously need not play mixes car uploading play car much closer final well isolated unit also rubber legs really helps avoid transference surface stands fully frontal facing driver reflex port allows directional sound not matters much thin fills entire room leaks rest house
Review: it‚Äôs what a small home studio requires. as an edm artist i like my tracks to have plenty of low end, and 3-7‚Äù monitor speakers fail to provide that deep sub bass reproduction, so a dedicated sub will always be needed to monitor them low frequencies, headphones get a part of the way there, but you will still miss valuable frequencies as true sub bass is felt instead of heard..i‚Äôm very impressed with the impact of such a small unit, it drives them body blows of sub bass straight to your gut, and really fills that gap in my frequencies, it‚Äôs speeded my workflow up tremendously as i now need not play my mixes in the car before uploading them, or when i do play then in the car they are much closer to being final..it‚Äôs a very well isolated unit also, having the rubber legs really helps avoid transference to the surface it stands on, and the fully frontal facing driver and reflex port allows me to be more directional with the sound, not that it matters too much because this thin fills the entire room and leaks in to the rest of the house.

Review: slight modification made all the difference.. since owning the sub i was always aware of a slight hum from the transformer. i tried a power conditioner that didn't make any difference. it will void the warranty as i did but i removed the amp from the back and found that the hum was coming from the transformer reveberating through the body of the sub. i ordered some m4 10mm x 15mm rubber mounts from amazon and mounted the transformer with them. i added a silicone tubing to hang under the transformer for added support. i thought i had done something wrong because when i turned it on i thought it wasn't working because it was silent. am very happy with it now. sounds great when you want it to, and doesn't make a sound when you don't want it to. these are the mounts i used..... https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/b07qv8vmxh/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o03_s00?ie=utf8&psc=1
Title: slight modification made all the difference.

Clean Review: brilliant audio already pair harbeth dmp1 dpm1 mini bought new summerhouse active bluetooth essential used mainly projector soeaker android studio whilst not harbeth not expecting way better expected details follow stereo separation perfect almost harbeth standard clarity unbelievably good every instrument heard bass yes spades clear unmuffled not need turn controls perfect standard not believe anyone says lacking treble turned tage tinitus even standard excellent not need touch nice adjustment power yes enough listening music like studio mixed working number studios know talking reading reviews another brand bit concerned not need though everything hoped value money without doubt sound quality way price paid recommend anyone number reasons home studio yes perfect tv youtube etc yes better surround sound artificial natural clarity separation bass better subwoofer not needed given 10 stars
Review: just brilliant audio.. i already own a pair of harbeth dmp1 and dpm1 mini. bought these for the new summerhouse, being active and bluetooth was essential, being used mainly as projector soeaker and android studio...whilst not up to the harbeth, i wasn't expecting them to be, but they are way better than expected. details follow...stereo separation is perfect almost up to harbeth standard...clarity-unbelievably good, every instrument can be heard...bass- yes in spades, it's clear and unmuffled. won't need to turn this up on the controls it's perfect at standard. don't believe anyone who says it's lacking...treble-turned this up a tage but i have tinitus, even at standard it's excellent. most won't need to touch it but for me it's nice to have the adjustment...power-yes more than enough...listening to music it is like being in the studio where it was mixed. working in a number of studios i know what i'm talking about...reading reviews of this and another brand i was a bit concerned. didn't need to be though. everything i'd hoped for and more...value for money, without doubt, sound quality is way above the price paid. i'd recommend these to anyone, for a number of reasons...home studio, yes perfect. tv and youtube etc again yes, better than surround sound which is artificial, the natural clarity separation and bass is better. subwoofer will not be needed...if i could have given 10 stars i would.
Title: just brilliant audio.

Clean Review: good desktop speakers not true monitors reviews suggest presonus quality control issue eris 3 5 no problems mine happy report no hum imperceptible hiss even volume turned right channels equally loud connected unbalanced rca cables focusrite scarlett 2i4 sound clear much bass expect small woofers plenty treble midrange good reasonable amounts detail used desk mounted near field speakers volume levels adequate eq controls back left hand master speaker limited use found little point adjusting bass control turning made sound confused flabby without actually making go deeper want lots deep bass small speakers adding subwoofer way go however rather splashy treble benefit turned bit speakers plenty bright whether monitors no not really decent sounding desktop speakers fair price huge improvement cheap plastic ones bright reliable mixing mastering tend create mix sound dull balanced speakers also quite hopeless setting bass levels correctly one last positive comment no automatic turn inactive period one sees many powered speakers less risk missing alert speakers decided go power saving mode
Review: good desktop speakers, but not true monitors. some of the reviews here suggest that presonus have a quality control issue with the eris 3.5. no such problems with mine, i'm happy to report. no hum, imperceptible hiss even with the volume turned right up, and both channels are equally loud...connected by unbalanced rca cables to my focusrite scarlett 2i4, the sound is clear with as much bass as you'd expect from such small woofers and plenty of treble. the midrange is good with reasonable amounts of detail. when used as desk-mounted near-field speakers, volume levels are very adequate...the eq controls on the back of the left-hand (master) speaker are of limited use. i found little point in adjusting the bass control as turning it up just made the sound confused and flabby without actually making it go any deeper. if you want lots of deep bass from small speakers then adding a subwoofer is the only way to go. however, the rather splashy treble does benefit from being turned down a bit as these speakers are plenty bright...as for whether they are "monitors"; no, not really. they are decent-sounding desktop speakers at a fair price that are a huge improvement on cheap plastic ones, but they're too bright for reliable mixing and mastering, and would tend to create a a mix that would sound dull on other, more balanced speakers, and would also be quite hopeless for setting bass levels correctly...one last positive comment - there's no automatic turn-off after an inactive period as one sees with many powered speakers, so there's less risk of missing an alert because your speakers have decided to go into power-saving mode.
Title: good desktop speakers, but not true monitors
Content: some of the reviews here suggest that presonus have a quality control issue with the eris 3.5. no such problems with mine, i'm happy to report. no hum, imperceptible hiss even with the volume turned right up, and both channels are equally loud...connected by unbalanced rca cables to my focusrite scarlett 2i4, the sound is clear with as much bass as you'd expect from such small woofers and plenty of treble. the midrange is good with reasonable amounts of detail. when used as desk-mounted near-field speakers, volume levels are very adequate...the eq controls on the back of the left-hand (master) speaker are of limited use. i found little point in adjusting the bass control as turning it up just made the sound confused and flabby without actually making it go any deeper. if you want lots of deep bass from small speakers then adding a subwoofer is the only way to go. however, the rather splashy treble does benefit from being turned down a bit as these speakers are plenty bright...as for whether they are "monitors"; no, not really. they are decent-sounding desktop speakers at a fair price that are a huge improvement on cheap plastic ones, but they're too bright for reliable mixing and mastering, and would tend to create a a mix that would sound dull on other, more balanced speakers, and would also be quite hopeless for setting bass levels correctly...one last positive comment - there's no automatic turn-off after an inactive period as one sees with many powered speakers, so there's less risk of missing an alert because your speakers have decided to go into power-saving mode.

Review: compact yet impressive. i had been looking at these for awhile before i took the plunge - and i'm very glad i bought them!..for many years i had used the bose companion set of speakers with a small subwoofer connected to my pc. they were a bit overpriced but sounded great...when the control unit packed up on them i was struggling to find a worthy replacement. like another reviewer, i tried the creative gigaworks t40 series ii - they were awful! not a very clear sound at all and no matter how i adjusted thyem they were swamped with a muddy mid sound. although i'm not a music producer i do like to be able to hear my music clearly and these little units do the trick very well indeed...quick and easy to unpack and install, the pads to isolate them from whatever you stand them on are a very nice addition. i connected them to my computer and immediately noticed what i'd been missing...i will probably use the tuning controls on the back to get them exactly how i want them but even without doing that, the audio quality and soudstage are really very good. i'd say money well spent on these units...i listen to a very wide range of music styles and genres, so far they all sound great.
Title: compact yet impressive

Review: surprisingly good for audio. i bought these in a rush as the power socket broke on my trusty (and very old) roland ma-10s broke. in an ideal world i would have gone for the krk ones to replace but i just don't have that kind of scratch right now and i really couldn't wait, i had stuff i needed to do and didn't want to waste even a single day. these arrived the next day which was really impressive...at first when they arrived i was disappointed. they looked really cheap and plasticky and were nowhere near as solid as the (mdf) rolands. i almost thought about sending them back tbh, they just didn't look like they were up to the job. i saw how they are referred to as 'multimedia monitors' and not 'studio monitors' on the box and got that sinking feeling that i'd wasted my money......i decided to plug them in and listen to them. at first they didn't sound that pleasant. its a very 'active' sound, very blown up and unnatural. but i compared it to my rolands and a/b'd them for a while and conditioned my ears to the new sound and then started to realise how bad the rolands actually were. they were so fizzy and boomy in comparison, the mids seemed scooped too, they were masking all kinds of problems. on these i could straight away notice some quite major flaws in the low and high ends of the track i was working on which wasn't apparent before. people are saying they are no good for below 80hz (which figures with such small cones) but tbh i've been quite impressed with the bass response so far. i would say 80-120hz is actually very clear. for the sub bass i would use headphones anyway, seriously these seem fine for audio use...i have a full size pair of roland ds-7s which cost a few hundred quid which i absolutely love and they don't compare to those at all. i actually like listening to music on those where as these are just a tool. these will be my convenient, low volume, day to day monitors...but yeah i'm very happy with these. if you were a beginner these would be perfect as your main monitors for a
Title: surprisingly good for audio
Content: i bought these in a rush as the power socket broke on my trusty (and very old) roland ma-10s broke. in an ideal world i would have gone for the krk ones to replace but i just don't have that kind of scratch right now and i really couldn't wait, i had stuff i needed to do and didn't want to waste even a single day. these arrived the next day which was really impressive...at first when they arrived i was disappointed. they looked really cheap and plasticky and were nowhere near as solid as the (mdf) rolands. i almost thought about sending them back tbh, they just didn't look like they were up to the job. i saw how they are referred to as 'multimedia monitors' and not 'studio monitors' on the box and got that sinking feeling that i'd wasted my money......i decided to plug them in and listen to them. at first they didn't sound that pleasant. its a very 'active' sound, very blown up and unnatural. but i compared it to my rolands and a/b'd them for a while and conditioned my ears figures with such small cones) but tbh i've been quite impressed with the bass response so far. i would say 80-120hz is actually very clear. for the sub bass i would use headphones anyway, seriously Review: wow are the cases resonant. i've had my pair of e3.5's for about 3 hours as of writing this review. they sound pretty good now...but to my ears, they didn't before tinkering.....the cases are 1/4" mdf, sound very resonant when knocked, and could be felt to move due to bass notes. this colours the sound quite a bit with a sort of boxy boomy nonsense going in the upper bass/lower male voice region...to cure them, opened them up and added sound-deadening mat to the walls as well as a few small cross braces. fun opening the right-hand speaker is it's glued together. so carefully cut the back off using the table saw...you can probably accomplish most of this by turning them on their sides and putting a pile of books on them to stops the sides from vibrating...the port still seems set slightly high. presumably to get a flat (or slight rise in bass response as that sells). i prefer a slight roll-off, so printing short flared extensions for the ports for the inside of the cabinet. in essence, i'm after the response somewhere between blocked ports and the as purchased response. so lengthening it a bit will lower the resonance and also slightly scupper the coupling...the amp within them is a tda 7265 to save anyone screwdriver effort to get there - also not very "studio"...in conclusion, they're not studio quality monitors at all. can't even be bothered to get out the test gear for them. but fun as a sunday project to buy dinky speakers and get them working a little better was pleasing. they work well with my headphones, which automatically switch over to the speakers when turned off. and now the case resonances are out the way of human voices will be great for conference calls and a bit of spotify while working...giving 3/5 as not good enough to be monitors, being that they colour the sound too much in stock form. but not 0, as were fun to play with and are now fixed. i didn't need monitors. if i did, then would purchase genelec whose factory i'll be touring soon (and will probably purchase some for by

Clean Review: money amazing try amazing trying get decent pc speakers ages managed get decent headphones akg k612 pro never decent speakers last set upgraded creative gigaworks t40 series ii 2 0 ok not cheap guess dropped idea pc speakers long ago putting ok creative labs effort not get started eu power saving garbage getting habit perma wearing headphones finally decided check studio monitors reluctantly seen price pull trigger pair yamaha hs5 saw review compared presonus e3 5 well circa 25 price yamaha not take much convincing presonus arrived 2 hours ago not going back not believe less price creative labs efforts bought last year mostly listen classical binge watch streaming services seems really suit type monitors much like reference headphones mentioned earlier no sound guru sound perfect looks yes plain matt black well want hear not see no rgb shame accessories come power lead no separate power brick thankfully cables mini jack mini jack mini jack left right phono speaker wire get people running also acoustic pads stick base side mine side screen desk well doubts reading reviews watching youtube reviews not unless happy pull trigger yamaha hs5 look no certainly recommending friends colleagues p not go sleep drop hat like creative speakers no missing reminders
Review: .....for the money they are amazing. i'll try that again, 'they are amazing'.. have been trying to get decent pc speakers for ages, have managed to get decent headphones (akg k612 pro), but never decent speakers. the last set i "upgraded" to were creative gigaworks t40 series ii (2.0), and they were "ok", and not cheap. i guess i should have dropped the idea of "pc speakers" long ago...so, after putting up with the "ok" creative labs effort (don't get me started on the eu power saving garbage), and getting into the habit of perma-wearing headphones. i finally decided to check out 'studio monitors' and was about to 'reluctantly' (have you seen the price) pull the trigger on a pair of yamaha hs5's when i saw a review of those compared to the presonus e3.5...well at circa a 25% of the price of the yamaha's, i didn't take much convincing. the presonus arrived about 2 hours ago and they will not be going back. i just can't believe that they were less than the price of the creative labs 'efforts' i bought last year...mostly i listen to classical and binge watch streaming services, which seems to really suit these type of monitors, much like the reference headphones i mentioned earlier...i'm no sound guru, but to me they sound 'perfect'. as for the looks, yes they are plain matt black, well i want to hear them not see them, and no rgb, shame ;-)..as for accessories, they come with a power lead (no separate power brick, thankfully) and cables (mini jack to mini jack, mini jack to left/right phono, and some speaker wire) that will get most people up and running, also some acoustic pads to stick to the base or side...mine are on their side under the screen on my desk, and..well if you have any doubts after reading other reviews or watching youtube reviews, don't. unless your happy to pull the trigger on those yamaha hs5's i'd look no further than here...i'll certainly be recommending these to friends and colleagues...p.s. ...and they don't go to sleep at the drop of a hat like the creative speakers do, so no more missing reminders.
Title: .....for the money they are amazing. i'll try that again, 'they are amazing'.
Content: have been trying to get decent pc speakers for ages, have managed to get decent headphones (akg k612 pro), but never decent speakers. the last set i "upgraded" to were creative gigaworks t40 series ii (2.0), and they were "ok", and not cheap. i guess i should have dropped the idea of "pc speakers" long ago...so, after putting up with the "ok" creative labs effort (don't get me started on the eu power saving garbage), and getting into the habit of perma-wearing headphones. i finally decided to check out 'studio monitors' and was about to 'reluctantly' (have you seen the price) pull the trigger on a pair of yamaha hs5's when i saw a review of those compared to the presonus e3.5...well at circa a 25% of the price of the yamaha's, i didn't take much convincing. the presonus arrived about 2 hours ago and they will not be going back. i just can't believe that they were less than the price of the creative labs 'efforts' i bought last year...mostly i listen to classical and binge watch streaming services, which seems to really suit these type of monitors, much like the reference headphones i mentioned earlier...i'm no sound guru, but to me they sound 'perfect'. as for the looks, yes they are plain matt black, well i want to hear them not see them, and no rgb, shame ;-)..as for accessories, they come with a power lead (no separate power brick, thankfully) and cables (mini jack to mini jack, mini jack to left/right phono, and some speaker wire) that will get most people up and running, also some acoustic pads to stick to the base or side...mine are on their side under the screen on my desk, and..well if you have any doubts after reading other reviews or watching youtube reviews, don't. unless your happy to pull the trigger on those yamaha hs5's i'd look no further than here...i'll certainly be recommending these to friends and colleagues...p.s. ...and they don't go to sleep at the drop of a hat like the creative speakers do, so no more missing reminders.

Clean Review: not studio monitor anywhere close pretty good speakers money not anyway shape form studio monitors preposterous marketing hype presonus thoroughly ashamed not least know perfectly well make studio grade gear not concern people thinking realistically spend less hundred quid get kind flat uncoloured sound real studio monitor deliver get realistically talking hundreds pounds per speaker decent home studio set thousands pounds per speaker professional studio set without considering room acoustic treatment etc reality check said decent speakers not monitors speakers enjoy not pretending trying mix b headphones car stereo earbuds etc learn
Review: not a studio monitor or anywhere close, but . . .. these are pretty good speakers for the money. but they are not in anyway shape or form "studio monitors" - that is just preposterous marketing hype and presonus should be thoroughly ashamed of themselves, not least because they know perfectly well how to make studio grade gear. these are not that...my concern is for people thinking they can realistically spend less than a hundred quid and get the kind of flat uncoloured sound a real studio monitor would deliver, but to get that, you're realistically talking about hundreds of pounds per speaker for a decent home studio set up and thousands of pounds per speaker for a professional studio set up. and that's without considering room acoustic treatment etc. just a reality check. all that said, these are decent speakers - not monitors - speakers. enjoy them for what they are, not what they're pretending to be. and if you're trying to mix on them, just a/b with headphones, car stereo, earbuds etc, so you learn them.
Title: not a studio monitor or anywhere close, but . . .

Review: these are great monitors.. i love the eris 3.5‚Äôs, i already own the eris e5‚Äôs and wanted monitors that would compliment them, i also added the presonus sub 8 subwoofer and routed them all through my presonus monitor station v2. i am thrilled at the clarity and depth this set up gives me. we record & mix vocal tracks and needed to hear the various frequencies clearly, this has been achieved. i highly recommend this product...i am an independant writer producer who mainly worked in large rooms, my home set up was for composition and ideas, since the pandemic we decided to upgrade our room with a new soundcraft digital desk, new imac and an 88 key nektar lx88 controller keyboard, the next phase was monitors. the eris 3.5‚Äôs completed our upgrade and we are now very happy, the 3.5‚Äôs are affordable and well made with a fantastic flat response, perfect for creators of any level and a great starting point for home studio monitoring.

Review: great sound and value. don‚Äôt worry about hiss or hum.. i was a bit worried about purchasing these as there are quite a few reviews complaining about mains hum and hiss. i can report that you can hear a hiss only if you put your ear up to the speaker, that you will get with all active speakers, you get a mild buzzing sound from the left one when you are connected with bluetooth. these are both very minor and nothing to worry about (i am very fussy). the majority of bad reviews i think are relating to the older version of these. presonus seem to have addressed the problem quite well with this newer version..the most important thing is the sound and i think that these sound fantastic for the money. i have been a so called audiophile for the last 45 years and i have spent way more money than this on passive speakers that don‚Äôt sound as good..regarding the sound, i am using these for listening to music not for mixing or production. these are near field monitors which means that you sit only a few feet away from them to get the best sound, they will fill most rooms not a problem but the best sound is found when you sit close to them..because these are designed to be uses in a studio the sound is not emphasised at all, you get a pretty flat frequency response. with these speakers poor recordings sound poor and great recordings sound great. all in all i am really happy with these.
Title: great sound and value. don‚Äôt worry about hiss or hum.

Review: bass response is nonexistent. i like these speakers for mixing- i have a small setup (laptop, keyboard controller and the speakers). they give you a really good idea of balancing levels but- it's really difficult to balance bass instruments as there is virtually no bass response. i have to switch to headphones to do that. trying to eq a bass instrument is very difficult on these speakers. if they had a better bass response then i would give 10/10 for this product. the mid, treble and stereo image are very accurate though. i'm still glad i got these speakers though.
Title: bass response is nonexistent

Review: great sound, poor legacy bluetooth connectivity. despite the cheap feeling plastic case these actually produce a very pleasing sound. deep and detailed enough for use on a desk for sure...bluetooth paired up instantly with 2021 macbook air and played flawlessly. however, i bought them to sit either side of a 2012 imac running os 10.11.6. forget it. spotify refused to accept there was anything to play through, and any native mac sound source was stuttering and distorted...unfortunately have had to return. if i end up ditching the old tech i'd certainly buy them again.

Review: excellent sounds from such compact units. i was surprised by the quality of sounds from such compact units. i have bought similar units in the past & been slightly disappointed by both the build & sound quality, but not in this case. the presonus units feel solidly built & the quality of sound from such compact units is excellent. i dabble in music making so being able to hear subtle differences in timbre from different instruments is important & these speakers deliver. i like the option of the headphone jack on the front for those occasions when needed. the improvement in sounds for my gaming has also been very welcome. the added bonus of a decent daw was a pleasant surprise. recommended.

Clean Review: 25 mins ka bloey replacements working reliability concerns remain got item today sounded good 25 mins connected via line playing music buzz crackle flash dead assumption amp left unit shorted amazon really good risked ordering replacement see one like moment not impressed 14 07 2021 working set speakers well working 3 days sound quality good good full range hearing devices set flat equalisation speakers set sound quality great no boomy bass read reviews played selection music opera heavy rock pop rnb reset rating 3 1 star not based sound quality excellent worthy 5 stars ongoing concerns longevity reliability reference balancing 4m square room not turned speakers quarter yet speakers stood acoustic pads prevent sound bleed vibration wooden desk stood
Review: 25 mins and ka-bloey!! replacements working but reliability concerns remain.. got this item today. sounded good for all of 25 mins when connected via a line in playing music. then buzz, crackle, flash and dead. my assumption is the amp in the left unit has shorted. amazon have been really good and i've risked ordering a replacement. will see what that one is like but at the moment am not impressed..14/07/2021-i now have a working set of speakers (well they've been working 3 days!). sound quality is good. i have good full range hearing and, as such all my devices are set to flat equalisation - and these speakers are set the same. sound quality is great. no "boomy bass" that i'd read in other reviews and i've played a selection of music through them from opera to heavy rock to pop and rnb. i'll reset my rating to a 3 from 1 star - not based on the sound quality which is excellent and worthy of 5 stars - but just on my ongoing concerns on longevity and reliability. for reference i'm balancing in a 4m square room and haven't turned the speakers up above a quarter yet. both speakers are stood on acoustic pads to prevent sound bleed/vibration into the wooden desk on which they're stood.
Title: 25 mins and ka-bloey!! replacements working but reliability concerns remain.
Content: got this item today. sounded good for all of 25 mins when connected via a line in playing music. then buzz, crackle, flash and dead. my assumption is the amp in the left unit has shorted. amazon have been really good and i've risked ordering a replacement. will see what that one is like but at the moment am not impressed..14/07/2021-i now have a working set of speakers (well they've been working 3 days!). sound quality is good. i have good full range hearing and, as such all my devices are set to flat equalisation - and these speakers are set the same. sound quality is great. no "boomy bass" that i'd read in other reviews and i've played a selection of music through them from opera to heavy rock to pop and rnb. i'll reset my rating to a 3 from 1 star - not based on the sound quality which is excellent and worthy of 5 stars - but just on my ongoing concerns on longevity and reliability. for reference i'm balancing in a 4m square room and haven't turned the speakers up above a quarter yet. both speakers are stood on acoustic pads to prevent sound bleed/vibration into the wooden desk on which they're stood.

Review: fine for desktop use. bought these for desktop use for a home office where i wanted a some decent speakers for the endless zoom calls!. they are nice and clear, however i have to say they are a little boomy at the 120hz range, so voices can resonate at that annoying frequency. ive ended up turning the 'low' eq dial right down to counteract it. having said that they're nice bright, so speech is clear. music sounds ok, though you wouldnt really get these if that was your primary use for them. these are nice compact units, plenty of volume and easy to set up. i would have scored them higher if they had usb input but you cant have everything for eighty quid i guess.

Review: excellent mid price monitors.. okay, i'll be honest here, these 4.5" are my first pair of studio monitors so my remarks need to be taken in that context...in short, i like them, i went through loads of reviews and canvassed quite a few experienced home studio owners and these speakers were generally well regarded, as were their' smaller siblings the eris 3.5". in use, i find them really good, they are certainly loud enough to be heard and articulate enough so that you can hear every nuance of sound. to date and taking my lack of experience into consideration , they have totally lived up to expectation so far and i don't believe that i will be upgrading for some time to come.

Review: my experience with these speakers. awesome set of speakers, before i bought it, i did a good bit of reading reviews, googling & checking out youtube. i had my concerns of course, but thankfully these speakers met my needs and there is no hum or white noises from them for me and i enjoy the sound quality delivered by the speakers, even the bass sounds rich & amazing to me. i have my tv & pc via a sound card hooked upto these speakers. only thing i wish is that there was a sleep/timer power off mode for these speakers for those times when i fall asleep whilst watching a movie late at night, all my other gear i have, have sleep timers for ie pc & tv. anyway just my 2 cents on these speakers i'm happy with them..ps. size of my room around 9ftx9ft.. acoustic tuning controls on speakers i have set to zero & volume about 1/4 set, when i want more volume i just turn up my source volume a bit. yes these speakers can get loud as an old midi hifi/speakers i used to have :0
Title: my experience with these speakers
Content: awesome set of speakers, before i bought it, i did a good bit of reading reviews, googling & checking out youtube. i had my concerns of course, but thankfully these speakers met my needs and there is no hum or white noises from them for me and i enjoy the sound quality delivered by the speakers, even the bass sounds rich & amazing to me. i have my tv & pc via a sound card hooked upto these speakers. only thing i wish is that there was a sleep/timer power off mode for these speakers for those times when i fall asleep whilst watching a movie late at night, all my other gear i have, have sleep timers for ie pc & tv. anyway just my 2 cents on these speakers i'm happy with them..ps. size of my room around 9ftx9ft.. acoustic tuning controls on speakers i have set to zero & volume about 1/4 set, when i want more volume i just turn up my source volume a bit. yes these speakers can get loud as an old midi hifi/speakers i used to have :0

Clean Review: accurate highs not bass pretty good price particularly accurate detailed high frequencies good stereo definition bass different matter however revealing distinctive frequency bump 150hz sound artificially boomy without subs obviously not much sub 100hz given small size speakers rolling bass controls helps little bit 150hz peak remains used mixing think good three four hour session low volume ear fatigue longer especially higher volumes
Review: accurate on the highs not so on the bass. these are pretty good at this price...they are particularly accurate and detailed in the high frequencies with good stereo definition. the bass is a different matter, however, revealing a very distinctive frequency bump at 150hz...so it'll sound artificially 'boomy' without the subs (obviously not much sub-100hz given the small size of the speakers). rolling off the bass on the controls helps a little bit but the 150hz peak remains...used for mixing, i think these are good for a three-four hour session at low volume but there is some ear fatigue (for me) any longer than that, especially at higher volumes.
Title: accurate on the highs not so on the bass

Clean Review: outstanding price presonus really show last word professional audio speakers audio speakers sharp accurate way advertised 30hz cutoff yet despite still provide comfortable listening experience used non professional tasks speakers able push impressive volume small size however still monitors not expect fill large room sound amplifier quiet no audible hiss hum speakers even silent room also inputs disconnected one gripe speakers bright blue power led front volume knob unfortunate annoying darkened room however easily remedied small square black electrical tape price recommend anyone professional monitors cheap computer speaker manufacturers logitech probably give
Review: outstanding for the price.. presonus really show off why they are the last word in professional audio with these speakers...the audio from these speakers is sharp and accurate, all the way down the the advertised 30hz cutoff. yet despite this they still provide a comfortable listening experience when being used for non professional tasks...the speakers are able to push an impressive volume for there small size, however they are still monitors, don't expect them to fill a large room with sound. the amplifier's are very quiet with no audible hiss or hum from the speakers even in a silent room (also with the inputs disconnected)..the one gripe i have with these speakers is they have a bright blue power led on the front above the volume knob. this is unfortunate as it is very annoying in a darkened room, however is easily remedied with a small square of black electrical tape...for this price i would recommend these to anyone, with professional monitors this cheap most computer speaker manufacturers (logitech) should probably just give up.
Title: outstanding for the price.
Content: presonus really show off why they are the last word in professional audio with these speakers...the audio from these speakers is sharp and accurate, all the way down the the advertised 30hz cutoff. yet despite this they still provide a comfortable listening experience when being used for non professional tasks...the speakers are able to push an impressive volume for there small size, however they are still monitors, don't expect them to fill a large room with sound. the amplifier's are very quiet with no audible hiss or hum from the speakers even in a silent room (also with the inputs disconnected)..the one gripe i have with these speakers is they have a bright blue power led on the front above the volume knob. this is unfortunate as it is very annoying in a darkened room, however is easily remedied with a small square of black electrical tape...for this price i would recommend these to anyone, with professional monitors this cheap most computer speaker manufacturers (logitech) should probably just give up.

Clean Review: great little speakers 3 weeks pleased bought use laptop running cubase gaming family use use wired using cubase audio comes via steinberg ur242 usb audio interface use phono leads take audio ur242 gaming use via bluetooth family paired phones play tunes speakers playing within 2 minutes unboxing no issues handy volume front also handy headphones front means monitor recording someone else using headphone ur242 records vocals sound punchy clear quite loud volumes play full volume get little distortion bass hey tiny eq tweaked bass treble handy leave 0 want accurate sound recording really glad spent quid get bluetooth version going sharing rest household like go option dedicated space home recording lucky wired version fine
Review: great little speakers. i've had these about 3 weeks and pleased with then. i bought them to use with my laptop running cubase, and for gaming and for the family to use. i use them wired when using cubase as the audio comes out via a steinberg ur242 usb audio interface and so use phono leads to take the audio from the ur242. when gaming i use them via bluetooth and the family have paired their phones so they can play their tunes. the speakers were playing within 2 minutes of unboxing, no issues at all. it's handy having the volume on the front and also handy having headphones out on the front as it means i can monitor there when recording if someone else is using the headphone out from the ur242 to records vocals. the sound is punchy and very clear up to quite loud volumes. play them at full volume and you might get a little distortion from the bass but hey, they're tiny! the eq can be tweaked (bass and treble) which is handy or just leave them at 0 if you want a more accurate sound when recording. i'm really glad a spent just a few quid more to get the bluetooth version and if you're going to be sharing these with the rest of the household like i am then go for that option. if you have a dedicated space for home recording (lucky you!) then the wired version would be fine.
Title: great little speakers

Clean Review: uncontrolled bass don normally review anything thought help others used work hi fi industry running hi fi shop many years nice setup lounge know thing two audio looked online many reviews often purchase many recommendations never good idea perhaps sometimes necessary purchased presonus eris e3 5 set ran presented sound uncontrolled low frequency much not live part speaker boxes lack rigidity bass bad colours everything improve things bringing away walls use good pair speakers stands mass loaded pc setups desk wall course know sound subjective love kind bass pretty sure make better pair cornflake box also worth saying presonus eris e3 5 priced budget pair pc speakers cost little understand also limiting factors like pc sound card unfortunately recommend due boomy uncontrolled bass
Review: uncontrolled bass. i don‚Äôt normally review anything but thought it would help others. i used to work in the hi fi industry running a hi fi shop for many years and have a very nice setup in my lounge, so know a thing or two about audio..having looked online at many reviews you often purchase on the many recommendations, this is never a good idea but perhaps sometimes necessary, so i purchased the presonus eris e3.5 and set them up and ran them in..i was presented with a sound that is so uncontrolled in the low frequency, so much so that i could not live with them, this is in part to do with the speaker boxes and lack of rigidity...the bass is so bad that it just colours everything, you could improve things by bringing them away from walls and use a good pair of speakers stands that are mass loaded but then most pc setups are on a desk and are against a wall. of course, i know sound is subjective and some will love that kind of bass but i am pretty sure i could make a better pair from a cornflake box, it‚Äôs also worth saying that the presonus eris e3.5 are priced as a budget pair of pc speakers and cost very little and i understand that there are also limiting factors like the pc sound card, but unfortunately, i can‚Äôt recommend them due to their boomy uncontrolled bass.
Title: uncontrolled bass

Clean Review: great budget speakers already e4 5s wanted downsize get space desk thoughts purchasing e3 5bt similar not sound profile e4 5s wrong sound e3 5bt thinner lacking significantly mid range highs excellent due 1 inch tweeter found versions lows excellent well not punchy e4 5s build quality speakers phenomenal price not think get better deal kevlar woven speakers price point read lot comments ac mains hum e3 5bt unit exhibit ac humming high volume 70 however not audible lower volumes absolutely great set volume lower level speakers crank volume source pc phone tablet etc also mention white background noise barely audible worrying factor bluetooth 5 0 great addition well pairs connects no issues however not support codecs aptx hd ldac got sbc work android phone conclusion e3 5bt great upgrading basic setup think absolutely enjoy speakers however believe e4 5s sound better better lows mids bad plan not work keeping e4 5s returning e3 5bt not think give sound quality square cm desk space going try audioengine a2 next
Review: great budget speakers. i already own the e4.5s and wanted to downsize to get more space on my desk. my thoughts purchasing the e3.5bt was that they'll have a similar, if not the same sound profile as the e4.5s. how wrong i was...the sound on the e3.5bt is thinner, lacking significantly in the mid-range. the highs are excellent due to the 1 inch tweeter found in both versions. the lows are excellent as well, but not as punchy as the e4.5s...the build quality of both speakers is phenomenal for the price. don't think you can get a better deal for kevlar woven speakers at this price point...i read a lot of comments about ac (mains) hum. my e3.5bt unit did exhibit ac humming at high volume (~>70%). however, its not audible at lower volumes which is absolutely great. you can set the volume at a lower level on the speakers and crank up the volume at the source (pc, phone, tablet etc). i do also have to mention that there's a white background noise, barely audible for it to be a worrying factor...bluetooth 5.0 is a great addition as well. pairs and connects with no issues. however it doesn't support codecs such as aptx-hd or ldac. only got sbc to work on my android phone...in conclusion, the e3.5bt is great if you're upgrading from a basic setup. i think you'll absolutely enjoy these speakers. however i do believe the e4.5s sound better. better lows and mids...too bad my plan didn't work. i'm keeping my e4.5s and returning the e3.5bt. i don't think i can give up the sound quality for a few square cm of desk space. i'm going to try the audioengine a2+ next.
Title: great budget speakers
Content: i already own the e4.5s and wanted to downsize to get more space on my desk. my thoughts purchasing the e3.5bt was that they'll have a similar, if not the same sound profile as the e4.5s. how wrong i was...the sound on the e3.5bt is thinner, lacking significantly in the mid-range. the highs are excellent due to the 1 inch tweeter found in both versions. the lows are excellent as well, but not as punchy as the e4.5s...the build quality of both speakers is phenomenal for the price. don't think you can get a better deal for kevlar woven speakers at this price point...i read a lot of comments about ac (mains) hum. my e3.5bt unit did exhibit ac humming at high volume (~>70%). however, its not audible at lower volumes which is absolutely great. you can set the volume at a lower level on the speakers and crank up the volume at the source (pc, phone, tablet etc). i do also have to mention that there's a white background noise, barely audible for it to be a worrying factor...bluetooth 5.0 is a great addition as well. pairs and connects with no issues. however it doesn't support codecs such as aptx-hd or ldac. only got sbc to work on my android phone...in conclusion, the e3.5bt is great if you're upgrading from a basic setup. i think you'll absolutely enjoy these speakers. however i do believe the e4.5s sound better. better lows and mids...too bad my plan didn't work. i'm keeping my e4.5s and returning the e3.5bt. i don't think i can give up the sound quality for a few square cm of desk space. i'm going to try the audioengine a2+ next.

Clean Review: impressive setup properly bluetooth better first got speakers really not like 1 bass boomy making low mid bit muddy checking presonus faqs recommended keep speakers away walls 4 feet 1 5ft mentioned elsewhere rear port pulled forward boomy muddyness gone delivering balanced sound detail punch thinking adding subwoofer not going bother like sound obviously speakers not shake room 2 background hiss using bluetooth higher using rca inputs presonus helped suggesting turning source e g phone maximum volume turning volume speakers hiss low enough not noticeable normal use 3 bluetooth mostly not reconnect previously paired devices press pair button every time turn speakers 4 volume not highest advertised may small e3 5 loud well clear not expect anything like home hifi 50w amp not turn home hifi much not annoying neighbors need turning much near field monitors not dj speakers balance love speakers great detailed balanced sound ideal streaming 6 music desk working home without disturbing rest house bluetooth better good enough use no way good enough music production not using bluetooth anyway ps no problems mains hum report probably not wired another piece mains equipment creates ground loops
Review: impressive - once setup properly but bluetooth could be better. when i first got these speakers, i really didn't like them..1. the bass was boomy making the low and mid all a bit 'muddy'. checking on the presonus faqs it is recommended to keep the speakers away from the walls by 4 feet (1.5ft mentioned elsewhere) because of the rear port, so i pulled them forward and the boomy muddyness had gone, delivering a balanced sound with detail and punch. i was thinking of adding a subwoofer but i'm not going to bother - i like the sound as is (obviously these speakers won't shake the room)..2. there is a background hiss when using bluetooth, higher than when using the rca inputs. presonus helped by suggesting turning the source (e.g. your phone) to maximum volume and turning down the volume on the speakers. the hiss is now low enough not to be noticeable in normal use..3. the bluetooth mostly doesn't reconnect to previously paired devices. i have to press the pair button every time i turn the speakers on.4. the volume isn't the highest. these are advertised ' it may be small but the e3.5 is loud, as well as clear' but don't expect anything like your home hifi with 50w amp. i don't turn my home hifi up much at all (not after annoying the neighbors) but these need turning up much more. but they are near field monitors not dj speakers...on balance, i love these speakers. great detailed balanced sound. ideal for streaming 6 music at my desk while working from home without disturbing the rest of the house. bluetooth could be better but good enough for my use, no way good enough for music production (but then you wouldn't be using bluetooth anyway)...ps no problems with mains hum as some report. this is probably because i've not wired them to another piece of mains equipment which creates ground loops.
Title: impressive - once setup properly but bluetooth could be better
Content: when i first got these speakers, i really didn't like them..1. the bass was boomy making the low and mid all a bit 'muddy'. checking on the presonus faqs it is recommended to keep the speakers away from the walls by 4 feet (1.5ft mentioned elsewhere) because of the rear port, so i pulled them forward and the boomy muddyness had gone, delivering a balanced sound with detail and punch. i was thinking of adding a subwoofer but i'm not going to bother - i like the sound as is (obviously these speakers won't shake the room)..2. there is a background hiss when using bluetooth, higher than when using the rca inputs. presonus helped by suggesting turning the source (e.g. your phone) to maximum volume and turning down the volume on the speakers. the hiss is now low enough not to be noticeable in normal use..3. the bluetooth mostly doesn't reconnect to previously paired devices. i have to press the pair button every time i turn the speakers on.4. the volume isn't the highest. these are advertised ' it may be small but the e3.5 is loud, as well as clear' but don't expect anything like your home hifi with 50w amp. i don't turn my home hifi up much at all (not after annoying the neighbors) but these need turning up much more. but they are near field monitors not dj speakers...on balance, i love these speakers. great detailed balanced sound. ideal for streaming 6 music at my desk while working from home without disturbing the rest of the house. bluetooth could be better but good enough for my use, no way good enough for music production (but then you wouldn't be using bluetooth anyway)...ps no problems with mains hum as some report. this is probably because i've not wired them to another piece of mains equipment which creates ground loops.

Clean Review: poor power supply two pairs speakers first pair failed turn third day use returned pair no trouble opted replacement always give second chance second pair audible hum unlikely ground loop outlet source tried others not loud hum may something others ignore noticed hear suspect issues sets related internal power supply ignoring issue speakers offer good sound good price
Review: poor power supply. i've had two pairs of these speakers, the first pair failed to turn on after their third day of use...i returned that pair with no trouble and opted for a replacement - i'll always give a second chance...the second pair had an audible hum - very unlikely to be a ground loop, it was on the same outlet as the source and i tried others - it wasn't a loud hum and may be something that others could ignore but once i noticed it, its all i could hear...i suspect that the issues that i had with both sets were related to the internal power supply. ignoring this issue, the speakers offer a good sound at a good price.
Title: poor power supply

Clean Review: accurate really good not best bass disclaimer not audiophile casual really good speakers use home gym 24ft 12ft got enough volume fill gym maintaining quality vocals instruments like string feel really accurate bass real punchy although not quite much want listen lot bassy grime dubstep definitely feels best around price type bookshelves enough pump workout need bass upgrade sub 5 1 logitech returned not looked back one bookshelves far outperforms logitech speakers
Review: accurate, really good (but not the best) bass. disclaimer: i'm not an audiophile, just a casual...really good speakers, i use it in a home gym 24ft √ó 12ft. they've got enough volume to fill the gym while maintaining quality...the vocals and instruments like that of string feel really accurate. the bass is real punchy, although not quite as much as i'd want it (i listen to a lot of bassy grime & dubstep). it definitely feels the best around for the price and type (being bookshelves). for now they're enough to pump me up during workout. if i need more bass i'd upgrade with a sub...before this i had the 5 in 1 logitech, returned those for these and haven't looked back. each one of these bookshelves far outperforms each of the logitech speakers.

Review: good speaker, poor build quality. these sound great...while they work. after three months, the slave speaker became much quieter than the active. then it started crackling. then distorting. then both speakers distorted. many others have reported this identical problem online, here and elsewhere. clearly poor electronics...i have owned my krk and yamaha monitors for almost twenty years, and they still work great. these lasted five months. granted, for a small, near field monitor, they sounded great while they worked.

Review: excellent sound, great value for money.. i originally bought some m-audio v32‚Äôs for my small home set up, they were awful, way too bass heavy, muddy sound and no adjustments. the presonus sound so much better. they feel very solidly built and have a crisp sound with plenty of power for a small set up, they get quite loud without much of a drop in sound quality when turned up. they also have basic equaliser knobs on the back but i‚Äôve never needed to change them from the central position. i‚Äôve started using them for general audio consumption over my bigger system for day to day listening because they sound so nice. definitely recommend for the price.

Clean Review: excellent rounders eris e4 5 really excellent rounders case hooked computer ess 9038 based dac mostly used gaming general media consumption lossless audio formats like flac even high quality mp3 sound absolutely spot even volume cranked highs crisp clear mid range natural sounding lovely definition low ends bass punchy deep no surprise bookshelf sized monitors not bad thing highs mids lows clean clearly distinguishable minimal overlapping bleeding case dedicated sub woofer always added require boomy rumbly bass sound set box found highs bit prominent taste easily rectifiable using tone control located rear left speaker case tend run different audio profiles eq settings source computer depending listening eris e4 5 sat desk 2 months happily recommend anyone looking affordable high quality speakers set
Review: excellent all-rounders.... the eris e4.5's really are excellent all-rounders. in my case, they're hooked up to a computer with an ess 9038-based dac and mostly used for gaming and general media consumption...lossless audio formats like .flac and even high-quality .mp3's sound absolutely spot on! even with the volume cranked up, highs are crisp and clear, and the mid-range is natural-sounding with lovely definition. the low-ends and bass are more punchy than deep, which is no surprise for bookshelf-sized monitors, but that's not a bad thing. highs, mids and lows are clean and clearly distinguishable with minimal overlapping or bleeding. in any case, a dedicated sub woofer could always be added for those who require more of a boomy or rumbly bass sound to their set-up...out of the box i found that the highs were a bit too prominent for my taste, but was easily rectifiable using the tone control located on the rear of the left speaker. in any case, i tend to run different audio profiles (eq settings) from the source (a computer) depending on what i'm doing or listening to...having had the eris e4.5's sat on my desk for ~ 2 months now, i would happily recommend them to anyone looking for affordable, high-quality speakers for their set-up.
Title: excellent all-rounders...
Content: the eris e4.5's really are excellent all-rounders. in my case, they're hooked up to a computer with an ess 9038-based dac and mostly used for gaming and general media consumption...lossless audio formats like .flac and even high-quality .mp3's sound absolutely spot on! even with the volume cranked up, highs are crisp and clear, and the mid-range is natural-sounding with lovely definition. the low-ends and bass are more punchy than deep, which is no surprise for bookshelf-sized monitors, but that's not a bad thing. highs, mids and lows are clean and clearly distinguishable with minimal overlapping or bleeding. in any case, a dedicated sub woofer could always be added for those who require more of a boomy or rumbly bass sound to their set-up...out of the box i found that the highs were a bit too prominent for my taste, but was easily rectifiable using the tone control located on the rear of the left speaker. in any case, i tend to run different audio profiles (eq settings) from the source (a computer) depending on what i'm doing or listening to...having had the eris e4.5's sat on my desk for ~ 2 months now, i would happily recommend them to anyone looking for affordable, high-quality speakers for their set-up.

Clean Review: excellent run separate electrical socket zero mains hum issues bought replace 3 audio speakers lasted 10 years 4 5 speakers sound much better perfect putting together rough mix general every day listening double electric socket near desk pc monitors usb stuff etc run single extension cord one socket speakers run socket absolutely no mains hum coming speakers running audio pc headphone speakers via 3 5mm aux front left hand speaker unit speakers plugged extension cord everything else mains hum speakers hope info helps someone
Review: excellent. run them on a separate electrical socket for zero mains hum issues.. i bought these to replace 3‚Äù m-audio speakers that lasted 10 years. these 4.5 speakers sound much better - perfect for putting together a rough mix, and general every day listening. i have a double electric socket near my desk. my pc, monitors , usb stuff etc run on a single extension cord into one socket. these speakers run into the other socket. there is absolutely no mains hum coming from the speakers. i‚Äôm running audio from the pc headphone out into the speakers via the 3.5mm aux in at the front of the left hand speaker unit...if the speakers are plugged into the extension cord with everything else there is mains hum from the speakers...i hope this info helps someone.
Title: excellent. run them on a separate electrical socket for zero mains hum issues.

Clean Review: wish bought mackie cr3 instead really not understand good reviews studio flat response monitors suck cheap hi fi speakers suck listening techno bass distorts wildly listening metal bass high end gets squished mid somehow listening punk music almost vanishes completely leaves vocals like kind reverse karaoke machine using headphone socket low volumes get loud hum turned daw totally red still hear plugged headphone socket tv watched dune millionth time sounded better ever calibrated speech cinema rather music presonus products know capable great things speakers not among
Review: wish i'd bought more mackie cr3's instead.. i really can't understand all the good reviews. as studio ''flat response'' monitors, these suck. as cheap hi-fi speakers, these suck....listening to techno through these and the bass distorts wildly. listening to metal and the bass and high end all gets squished into the mid somehow. and listening to punk through these and the music almost vanishes completely and leaves just the vocals, like they are some kind of reverse karaoke machine!...then using the headphone socket at low volumes and all i get is a loud hum, but when i turned these and my daw up until it was totally in the red i could still only just hear it....but when i plugged these in to the headphone socket of my tv and watched ''dune'' for the millionth time it sounded better than ever. what's with that?! are these calibrated for speech or cinema rather than music?...i have other presonus products, so i know that they are capable great things..but these speakers are not among them.
Title: wish i'd bought more mackie cr3's instead.
Content: i really can't understand all the good reviews. as studio ''flat response'' monitors, these suck. as cheap hi-fi speakers, these suck....listening to techno through these and the bass distorts wildly. listening to metal and the bass and high end all gets squished into the mid somehow. and listening to punk through these and the music almost vanishes completely and leaves just the vocals, like they are some kind of reverse karaoke machine!...then using the headphone socket at low volumes and all i get is a loud hum, but when i turned these and my daw up until it was totally in the red i could still only just hear it....but when i plugged these in to the headphone socket of my tv and watched ''dune'' for the millionth time it sounded better than ever. what's with that?! are these calibrated for speech or cinema rather than music?...i have other presonus products, so i know that they are capable great things..but these speakers are not among them.

Clean Review: good value money not experience studio monitors done lot research listened many comparisons deciding pair speakers couple months using say happy purchase sound clear response quite flat across spectrum judging different commercial recordings sound no comparison monitors speakers low level hiss even volume knob turned way fact not seem anything volume need stick ear next monitor hear normal listening distance 1 metre not hear anything not problem
Review: good value for money. i don't have experience with studio monitors so i'd done a lot of research and listened to many comparisons before deciding on this pair of speakers. after a couple of months of using them i can say i'm happy with the purchase. the sound is clear and the response quite flat across the spectrum (judging how different commercial recordings sound - again, i've no comparison to other monitors)...the speakers have a low level hiss, even when the volume knob is turned all the way down (in fact it doesn't seem to have anything to do with the volume). but i need to stick my ear next to the monitor to hear it. at normal listening distance of about 1 metre i don't hear anything, so for me it's not a problem.

Review: just what i wanted. having grown up with bbc monitor speakers (spendor bc1 and rogers ls3/5a) before forced downsizing, i wanted a pair of small self-powered monitor speakers for tv, blu-ray and cd. good speech quality was essential. my audio router includes level control, so the volume on the master speaker can be set and left. top and bass +/- 6db is a bonus on the rear, with a tactile notch at 0. no noticeable noise from the amp..one surprise was a mains lead with european plug, but supplier had added a uk 13a mains lead.

Clean Review: true sound research needed computer speakers used watching films shows listening music wanted something true without enhanced bass nonsense apply via equaliser also wanted small lightish perfect plenty loud nice crisp clear sound 1 tweeters boom things go bang screen hear dialogue clear tested abbey road miss anthropocene 2 crisp produced albums separated 50 years loved results going purchase spec leads speaker wire may not need not sure improve sound anyone says not bossy enough obviously grown beats bass heavy rubbish fact turned bass notch great neutral
Review: true sound. did my research on these, as all i needed were computer speakers used both for watching films/shows and listening to music. so wanted something true, without enhanced bass and all that other nonsense which you can apply via an equaliser; also wanted small and lightish. they're perfect, plenty loud with a nice crisp clear sound from their 1" tweeters, and there's that boom when things go bang on screen + i can hear dialogue clear. tested on abbey road & miss anthropocene, 2 very crisp produced albums separated by 50 years, and loved the results. was going to purchase up spec leads and speaker wire, but may not need to, as i'm not sure it will improve the sound. anyone who says they're not bossy enough has obviously grown up on beats and other bass heavy rubbish; in fact, i've turned the bass down a notch, but it's great neutral.
Title: true sound
Content: did my research on these, as all i needed were computer speakers used both for watching films/shows and listening to music. so wanted something true, without enhanced bass and all that other nonsense which you can apply via an equaliser; also wanted small and lightish. they're perfect, plenty loud with a nice crisp clear sound from their 1" tweeters, and there's that boom when things go bang on screen + i can hear dialogue clear. tested on abbey road & miss anthropocene, 2 very crisp produced albums separated by 50 years, and loved the results. was going to purchase up spec leads and speaker wire, but may not need to, as i'm not sure it will improve the sound. anyone who says they're not bossy enough has obviously grown up on beats and other bass heavy rubbish; in fact, i've turned the bass down a notch, but it's great neutral.

Review: impressive speakers for the price. purchased as desktop speakers for use with computer (to replace maudio av40, which had failed after a number of years use). sound quality is subjective - various online / youtube reviews are generally very favourable - in my opinion sound quality (especially base) is very pleasing considering the size of the speakers and an improvement on the av40 (read the reviews for much more detailed comments on sound quality and comparisons). extra controls provide the opportunity to fine tune the sound. power / sound volume is more than adequate for my use in a smallish room. the controls / connections on the front are very convenient for my use. i also like the design aesthetic: very understated with no bold logo, distracting colours, lights etc.

Review: not powerfull but beautiful, clear sound. i've been using these monitors to listen to music and i'm quite impressed by the sound quality of them. low frequencies and bass lines sound so clear, not coloured in my opinion. high frequencies are nice and crispy too through these. i don't normally fiddle with the controls at the front & back but instead set everything to 0, volume at 50% and use volume and equalizer controls from my laptop...i'm planning to use them for music production too, so they'll be part of my tiny home studio. there not powerful at all but i quite really enjoy the fact that i can turn down the volume a bit and still distinguish different frequencies clearly...i'm not giving them 5 stars as i cannot compare with others side-by-side at the moment.

Review: best speakers for hundred quid! don't miss out!. these monitors are an absolute steal at this price, the original 3.5 are still selling out everywhere! nothing else at this price or below even comes close to the quality of sound and versatility of these amazing industrial looking boxes!..1 inch silk-dome tweeters are just something else on these beauties - the resolution, the extra wide sweetspot, the soundstage is all taken care of here. of course it's even covered with a small metal grate so fingers can't ruin them! bottom line, these tweeters are way better than anything i've ever experienced before... and i've had a lot of different speakers...not to forget about the 3.5 inch woven kevlar woofer finished off in dark blue/navy shade just adds such a touch of class. if you have natural light shining into your room/studio it just bounces off so nicely. won't improve the sound but definitely makes these eris monitors feel even more high quality. even down to the presonus badge, it really looks like it got some attention to detail. the ab amps are super quiet to turn on and operate, there's plenty of power at 25w per side for a medium sized studio room. i haven't even turned the volume knob past 35% at this point and i've had all the volume i needed so far!..i'm running mine from a decade old behringer uca222 audio interface with the ti pcm2902e dac chip via rca to trs cables - swapping l/r inputs to make sure the powered monitor is on the right due to preference. out of the box the active speaker is the left one, so remember that you can swap rca/trs if you wish!..conclusion - don't let the price fool you! these are a quality product, and i'm almost convicted with all the r&d that's gone into these boxes presonus are probably loosing money on each pair that they sell!!..the only con is the included speaker to speaker wire is a bit naff, but i picked up 3m of 99% ofc copper speaker wire from fleabay and couldn't be happier. it has cotton shielding and better transmission than stock wire. you can see it in the pictu

Clean Review: presonus eris 3 5 say get pay well ive certainly got moneys worth paid cheaper know however dont like sellers bad feedback anyway late night listening youtube netflix spotify needed speakers less bass neighbours got hold pair creative t10s ok not enjoyable listen next 129 99 edifier r1700bt solidly built well made aweful sound though bass way boomy starters turn kills whatever youre listening reading reviews like youre went looking pair speakers opinion id wasting time buying desktop speakers decided going buy monitors instead looking many brands reading reviews internet well settled buy presonus eris 3 5 going hours soundstage fantastic small speakers bass sweet mids highs clear sure tannoys better sounding daytime hours running arcam avr amp make flat shake however money well worth happy purchase job well done
Review: presonus eris 3.5. they say you get what you pay for. well ive certainly got my moneys worth. could of paid cheaper for these i know. however i just dont like sellers with bad feedback...anyway for late night listening to youtube netflix and spotify i needed some speakers with less bass. for the neighbours. so i got hold of a pair of creative t10s. they were ok but not an enjoyable listen. next was the ¬£129.99 edifier r1700bt. solidly built and well made. aweful sound though bass way to boomy for starters turn it down and it kills whatever youre listening to. so reading reviews like youre doing now i went looking again for a pair of speakers. it was my opinion id be wasting my time buying desktop speakers and decided i was going to buy monitors instead. so i was looking at so many brands, reading reviews here and on the internet. well i settled to buy these presonus eris 3.5. had them going for hours now. the soundstage is fantastic for such a small of speakers. the bass is sweet and the mids and highs clear. sure my tannoys are better sounding during the daytime hours and running from my arcam avr amp i can make my flat shake. however these for their money are well worth it and i am happy with my purchase. its a job well done

Clean Review: brilliant speakers speakers amazing price money saw lot reviews saying lot mains hum however using trs input no hum unless put ear speaker even noise minimal not tried rca hum using input order uk come uk plug no need worry buying adapter speakers price money amazing great mixing perfect bedroom studio like mine trs cables not come box need buy however get rca aux cable overall speakers amazing price perfect bedroom studio
Review: brilliant speakers!. these speakers are amazing for the price of money! i saw a lot of reviews saying there was a lot of mains hum however if your using trs input there is no hum unless you put your ear up to the speaker and even when doing that the noise is minimal. i have not tried rca so there could be more hum using that input. if you order in the uk it does come with a uk plug so no need to worry about buying an adapter:) these speakers for the price of money are amazing! they are great for mixing and perfect for a bedroom studio like mine! trs cables do not come in the box, so you will need to buy them, however you do get rca and an aux cable. overall these speakers are amazing for the price and are perfect for a bedroom studio!

Clean Review: presonus eris better small bookshelf speakers tried picked last week 69 another place honestly not believe quality reviews accurate minimalistic light clear presentation sparkly treble tightly controlled bass sensitive not worry also high freq low freq controls means adjust 6db plus minus rear main l speaker personally different live flat actually turned bass 1 2db sound great hooked somewhat antique fiio e7 dac amp wolfson 8740 audiophile level chip via 3 5mm rca loops uk audio cables sound signature synergy combo musical great definition sense space also tried xtrempro x1 ess sabre 9023 dac available amazon 34 shipped think sound synergy pretty cold rather forward aggressive still decent soundstage definitely analytical however gets fatiguing someone like listens music 2 hours day edit 14 05 upgraded slightly thin l r stock speaker wire get box much reliable 250 strand shielded cotton filled 99 9 ofc copper wire feel like definite differnce hey hooked today placebo aint going back stock cable thats sure also getting 3 5mm 6 35mm lr interconnect cable not balanced use trs inputs test see audio quality improves changes report back soon keep eye wanna know conclusion hands best speakers ever hooked pc owned many past trust cambridge soundworks 1byone edifier e10bt creative t20ii creative t40ii amazing much like dinosaurs go like jurassic park
Review: presonus eris are better than any small bookshelf speakers i've tried!. picked these up last week for ¬£69 from another place and honestly can't believe the quality of these. all reviews are accurate, these are as minimalistic as they are light. they have a very clear presentation with sparkly treble and tightly controlled bass, but if you're sensitive to that not to worry because they also have high freq and low freq controls which means you can adjust it by up to 6db plus or minus on the rear of the main (l) speaker...for me personally it's different because i live in a flat, i actually turned down the bass by -1 to -2db and they sound great hooked up to my somewhat antique fiio e7 dac/amp with a wolfson 8740 audiophile level chip via 3.5mm to rca loops uk audio cables. sound signature and synergy from this combo is very musical, with great definition and sense of space. i also tried it with an xtrempro x1 ess sabre 9023 dac (available here on amazon for about ¬£34 shipped i think), and the sound synergy is pretty cold, rather forward and aggressive but still with decent soundstage. definitely more analytical, however this gets fatiguing for someone like me who listens to music for 2+ hours a day!..edit (14/05): i have upgraded the slightly thin l/r stock speaker wire that you get in the box to a much more reliable 250~ strand shielded cotton filled 99.9% ofc copper wire and i feel like there is a definite differnce but hey i only hooked it up today so it could be just placebo. i aint going back to the stock cable thats for sure!..i will also be getting a 3.5mm to 6.35mm lr interconnect cable (not balanced) so i can use the trs inputs and test to see if the audio quality improves or changes. will report back here soon! keep an eye out if you wanna know...---.conclusion:..these are hands down the best speakers i've ever had hooked up to my pc... and i have owned many in the past - trust, cambridge soundworks, 1byone, edifier e10bt, creative t20ii, creative t40ii (amazing but very much like dinosaurs, go for them if you like jurassic park
Title: presonus eris are better than any small bookshelf speakers i've tried!
Content: picked these up last week for ¬£69 from another place and honestly can't believe the quality of these. all reviews are accurate, these are as minimalistic as they are light. they have a very clear presentation with sparkly treble and tightly controlled bass, but if you're sensitive to that not to worry because they also have high freq and low freq controls which means you can adjust it by up to 6db plus or minus on the rear of the main (l) speaker...for me personally it's different because i live in a flat, i actually turned down the bass by -1 to -2db and they sound great hooked up to my somewhat antique fiio e7 dac/amp with a wolfson 8740 audiophile level chip via 3.5mm to rca loops uk audio cables. sound signature and synergy from this combo is very musical, with great definition and sense of space. i also tried it with an xtrempro x1 ess sabre 9023 dac (available here on amazon for about ¬£34 shipped i think), and the sound synergy is pretty cold, rather forward and aggressive but still with decent soundstage. definitely more analytical, however this gets fatiguing for someone like me who listens to music for 2+ hours a day!..edit (14/05): i have upgraded the slightly thin l/r stock speaker wire that you get in the box to a much more reliable 250~ strand shielded cotton filled 99.9% ofc copper wire and i feel like there is a definite differnce but hey i only hooked it up today so it could be just placebo. i aint going back to the stock cable thats for sure!..i will also be getting a 3.5mm to 6.35mm lr interconnect cable (not balanced) so i can use the trs inputs and test to see if the audio quality improves or changes. will report back here soon! keep an eye out if you wanna know...---.conclusion:..these are hands down the best speakers i've ever had hooked up to my pc... and i have owned many in the past - trust, cambridge soundworks, 1byone, edifier e10bt, creative t20ii, creative t40ii (amazing but very much like dinosaurs, go for them if you like jurassic park
