Review: perfect - please presonus, never change these. in the eris e3.5, i've found the perfect speakers for my pc....but i would also say for a small room, these are the only speakers you'd need for any purpose...over the years i've tried various cambridge soundworks, logitechs, creatives etc. i used the gigaworks t40 series ii's for almost 10 years quite happily, they were good enough. until i got a fiio k3 amp/dac and didn't think they did it justice, so i started my search for upgraded monitors.....enter the tibo plus 1.1 (which cost more than these), but i found them to be too thin, harsh. they were more detailed than the t40s, but lacking any body to the sound and very shrill at even moderate volume ( i tried to get used to them, but i just couldnt).....so the search continued and i ordered these.... straight forward setup, all cables i required were provided..... 5 seconds in to some toto, i just grinned with delight, 2 hours later i was still going through my favourites playlist songs thinking... "i wonder how that song will sound on these?" ..... the answer was wonderful every time. rock, rap, blues, funk, hip-hop, jazz, classical, everything i tried just sounds so good. the treble is smooth yet detailed, but not piercing or fatiguing to my ears. the mids are there, and for such small speakers i can't believe the oomph these speaker pack. the bass is incredible for the size... even makes my desk vibrate (which the gigaworks t40s couldnt even do with two woofers). don't get me wrong... it's not sub bass, woofer style, but it's really clear and controlled. and i've learned that the numbers mean nothing... the tibo's frequency range started at 20hz, my creative's started at 50hz, and these e3.5's start at 80hz.... but they have the best, cleanest, punchiest, and deepest sounding bass out of those mentioned...nothing seems over emphasised to me, everything is 'there', all sounds and frequencies... i havent felt the need to adjust them, but there are bass/treble controls should you need them. i guess that's why thes
Title: perfect - please presonus, never change these
Content: in the eris e3.5, i've found the perfect speakers for my pc....but i would also say for a small room, these are the only speakers you'd need for any purpose...over the years i've tried various cambridge soundworks, logitechs, creatives etc. i used the gigaworks t40 series ii's for almost 10 years quite happily, they were good enough. until i got a fiio k3 amp/dac and didn't think they did it justice, so i started my search for upgraded monitors.....enter the tibo plus 1.1 (which cost more than these), but i found them to be too thin, harsh. they were more detailed than the t40s, but lacking any body to the sound and very shrill at even moderate volume ( i tried to get used to them, but i just couldnt).....so the search continued and i ordered these.... straight forward setup, all cables i required were provided..... 5 seconds in to some toto, i just grinned with delight, 2 hours later i was still going through my favourites playlist songs thinking... "i wonder how that song will sound on these?" ..... the answer was wonderful every time. rock, rap, blues, funk, hip-hop, jazz, classical, everything i tried just sounds so good. the treble is smooth yet detailed, but not piercing or fatiguing to my ears. the mids are there, and for such small speakers i can't believe the oomph these speaker pack. the bass is incredible for the size... even makes my desk vibrate (which the gigaworks t40s couldnt even do with two woofers). don't get me wrong... it's not sub bass, woofer style, but it's really clear and controlled. and i've learned that the numbers mean nothing... the tibo's frequency range started at 20hz, my creative's started at 50hz, and these e3.5's start at 80hz.... but they have the best, cleanest, punchiest, and deepest sounding bass out of those mentioned...nothing seems over emphasised to me, everything is 'there', all sounds and frequencies... i havent felt the need to adjust them, but there are bass/treble controls should you need them. i guess that's why thes

Review: brilliant. absolutely brilliant !!.needed some new speakers for my home dj‚Äôing as had my previous ones for a number of years and felt the sound wasn‚Äôt as clear as it could be. read the reviews and couldn‚Äôt find a bad one, and for the price thought i‚Äôd order a pair. they are small and as i have wall brackets, i did have to cut down the extendable arm on my brackets to enable them the clamp the speaker but these were existing brackets and i was gonna make them fit either way. they are probably better to sit on a desk or something which has no back, as the powered speaker has a power lead, the 2 rca connections and the speaker cable link to the other speaker..once they were set up and turned on the decks, was amazed by the clarity and how loud they were for such a small speaker. my set up is in a room smaller than a bedroom and have the speakers quite close to me. remember these a near field monitor speakers so probably no good for a big room..but definitely recommend for a small room set up as they have more than enough power.
Title: brilliant
Content: absolutely brilliant !!.needed some new speakers for my home dj‚Äôing as had my previous ones for a number of years and felt the sound wasn‚Äôt as clear as it could be. read the reviews and couldn‚Äôt find a bad one, and for the price thought i‚Äôd order a pair. they are small and as i have wall brackets, i did have to cut down the extendable arm on my brackets to enable them the clamp the speaker but these were existing brackets and i was gonna make them fit either way. they are probably better to sit on a desk or something which has no back, as the powered speaker has a power lead, the 2 rca connections and the speaker cable link to the other speaker..once they were set up and turned on the decks, was amazed by the clarity and how loud they were for such a small speaker. my set up is in a room smaller than a bedroom and have the speakers quite close to me. remember these a near field monitor speakers so probably no good for a big room..but definitely recommend for a small room set up as they have more than enough power.

Clean Review: small studio monitors pack great punch terms studio monitors experience 3 5 presonus monitors much larger much expensive yamaha hs8 monitors presonus monitors sound almost impressive yamaha rich treble thick bass makes mixing monitoring audio pleasure whole frequency spectrum cleanly audible range options input great bonus
Review: small studio monitors that pack a great punch. in terms of studio monitors, i only have experience with these 3.5" presonus monitors and the much larger, much more expensive yamaha hs8 monitors. the presonus monitors sound almost as impressive as the yamaha's. their rich treble and thick bass makes mixing and monitoring audio a pleasure. the whole frequency spectrum is cleanly audible and the range of options for input are a great bonus.
Title: small studio monitors that pack a great punch
Content: in terms of studio monitors, i only have experience with these 3.5" presonus monitors and the much larger, much more expensive yamaha hs8 monitors. the presonus monitors sound almost as impressive as the yamaha's. their rich treble and thick bass makes mixing and monitoring audio a pleasure. the whole frequency spectrum is cleanly audible and the range of options for input are a great bonus.

Clean Review: monitor quality budget got eris 4 5 powered speakers desktop mini daw setup general av use genelecs serious stuff needed something better pc speakers learning bass parts paid gb 139 00 amazon delivered next day notice newest version mk 2 jacks no range switches first impressions highly favourable bass extended real weight slam kick drum sounds true mids clean whole audio range basically neutral un coloured listening tracks working showed matched genelecs well mixes sounded similar imaging resolution good enough mix quite surprise budget speaker highly recommend anyone looking budget monitor music podcasts general av use
Review: monitor quality on a budget.. i got these eris 4.5 powered speakers for my desktop mini-daw setup and general av use..i have genelecs for serious stuff but needed something better than my pc speakers for learning bass parts. paid gb¬£139.00 and amazon delivered next day..(i notice these are the newest version (mk 2?) with the jacks above each other and no range switches)..first impressions are highly favourable. bass is extended with real weight and slam, kick drum sounds true..mids are clean and the whole audio range is basically neutral and un-coloured..listening to the tracks i'm working on showed they matched the genelecs very well and mixes sounded similar. imaging and resolution are good enough to mix with, quite a surprise in a budget speaker...i highly recommend these for anyone looking for a budget monitor for music or podcasts, or for general av use.
Title: monitor quality on a budget.
Content: i got these eris 4.5 powered speakers for my desktop mini-daw setup and general av use..i have genelecs for serious stuff but needed something better than my pc speakers for learning bass parts. paid gb¬£139.00 and amazon delivered next day..(i notice these are the newest version (mk 2?) with the jacks above each other and no range switches)..first impressions are highly favourable. bass is extended with real weight and slam, kick drum sounds true..mids are clean and the whole audio range is basically neutral and un-coloured..listening to the tracks i'm working on showed they matched the genelecs very well and mixes sounded similar. imaging and resolution are good enough to mix with, quite a surprise in a budget speaker...i highly recommend these for anyone looking for a budget monitor for music or podcasts, or for general av use.

Clean Review: small powerful needed multi media speakers new pc build downstairs already focal alpha home studio upstairs not really want something sub standard pc setup even though not main computer music small monitors good reviews though give go well say impressed plenty volume small desktop setup importantly quality sound much better imagined much actually spend time recording guitar pc downstairs actual home studio bear mind no expert not tons expensive gear etc feels right go
Review: small and powerful. i needed some multi-media speakers for my new pc build downstairs. i already have some focal alpha's in my home studio upstairs, so i didn't really want something sub-standard for my pc setup, even though it's not my main computer for doing music. these small monitors had good reviews, so i though i would give them a go. well, all i can say is, i'm very impressed. plenty of volume for a small desktop setup, but more importantly, the quality of sound is much better than i imagined. so much so, i actually spend more time recording guitar on my pc downstairs than i do in my actual home studio. bear in my mind, i am no expert, and i don't have tons of expensive gear, etc.. but, if it feels right, i just go with it..
Title: small and powerful
Content: i needed some multi-media speakers for my new pc build downstairs. i already have some focal alpha's in my home studio upstairs, so i didn't really want something sub-standard for my pc setup, even though it's not my main computer for doing music. these small monitors had good reviews, so i though i would give them a go. well, all i can say is, i'm very impressed. plenty of volume for a small desktop setup, but more importantly, the quality of sound is much better than i imagined. so much so, i actually spend more time recording guitar on my pc downstairs than i do in my actual home studio. bear in my mind, i am no expert, and i don't have tons of expensive gear, etc.. but, if it feels right, i just go with it..

Clean Review: wonderful pair speakers practical desktop not audiophile looking simple good enough pair speakers desktop play music use computer looking lot online ended buying not really sure glad say wonderful sound fantastic full crisp hear everything really well lots details not noticed not take much space really simple set not require external amp anything also not playing anything completely silent no distracting white noise plus controls user interface perfect easy turn easy plug headphones easy control volume shape solid flat top put things top
Review: wonderful pair of speakers, practical for your desktop. i am not an audiophile. i was looking for a simple and good enough pair of speakers for my desktop to play music while i use the computer. after looking a lot online i ended up buying these but wasn't really sure about them. i'm glad to say they are wonderful!..the sound is fantastic, full and crisp. i can hear everything really well, with lots of details that i had not noticed before. they don't take up much space, and are really simple to set up (they don't require any external amp or anything)...also when i am not playing anything, they are completely silent! no distracting white noise...plus the controls and user interface are perfect: easy to turn on and off, easy to plug headphones on, and easy to control the volume...their shape is solid and flat at the top, so you can put things on top of them too.
Title: wonderful pair of speakers, practical for your desktop
Content: i am not an audiophile. i was looking for a simple and good enough pair of speakers for my desktop to play music while i use the computer. after looking a lot online i ended up buying these but wasn't really sure about them. i'm glad to say they are wonderful!..the sound is fantastic, full and crisp. i can hear everything really well, with lots of details that i had not noticed before. they don't take up much space, and are really simple to set up (they don't require any external amp or anything)...also when i am not playing anything, they are completely silent! no distracting white noise...plus the controls and user interface are perfect: easy to turn on and off, easy to plug headphones on, and easy to control the volume...their shape is solid and flat at the top, so you can put things on top of them too.

Clean Review: great value not blown away entry level studio monitors offer great value fairly decent sound little skeptical reviews mentioned static hum due power supply thankfully mine not issue also look great certainly feel like premium product price paid upgraded 40 pc speakers not blown away sound said time purchase around 90 pair considered low end professional set studio monitors no real complaints issue far main powered speaker definitely louder slave speaker either adjust output settings computer change speaker positioning try make not ideal solutions hence reason 4 stars rather 5 overall however decent purchase use 12 months considering upgrades
Review: great value, but not blown away,. these entry level studio monitors offer great value and a fairly decent sound. i was a little skeptical after some reviews had mentioned a static hum due to the power supply - thankfully mine have not had this issue...they also look great too and certainly feel like a premium product for the price paid. i had upgraded to these from some ¬£40 pc speakers and wasn't 'blown away' with the sound, but that being said, at the time of purchase, these were only around ¬£90 for the pair, which is considered to be at the low end for a professional set of studio monitors, so no real complaints there...the only issue for me so far, is that the main powered speaker is definitely louder than the slave speaker, and so i'm having to either adjust my output settings on my computer or change the speaker positioning to try and make up for this (both are not ideal solutions) - hence the reason for 4 stars, rather than 5...overall however, a decent purchase, which i'll use for 12 months or so before considering further upgrades.
Title: great value, but not blown away,
Content: these entry level studio monitors offer great value and a fairly decent sound. i was a little skeptical after some reviews had mentioned a static hum due to the power supply - thankfully mine have not had this issue...they also look great too and certainly feel like a premium product for the price paid. i had upgraded to these from some ¬£40 pc speakers and wasn't 'blown away' with the sound, but that being said, at the time of purchase, these were only around ¬£90 for the pair, which is considered to be at the low end for a professional set of studio monitors, so no real complaints there...the only issue for me so far, is that the main powered speaker is definitely louder than the slave speaker, and so i'm having to either adjust my output settings on my computer or change the speaker positioning to try and make up for this (both are not ideal solutions) - hence the reason for 4 stars, rather than 5...overall however, a decent purchase, which i'll use for 12 months or so before considering further upgrades.

Review: good sounding monitors. bought these to go in my second studio in the spare room. i have tannoys for my main space but the wife and i needed somewhere to create music on a whim and the desk space is limited. these are great as reference monitors for making music but i think i would struggle to get a mixdown with them...they sound great listening to music and yt etc. if you're just starting out in music production, need a mobile recording set up or like me just need a second pair of reliable sounding speakers, you'll be happy with this purchase. i may even buy a second pair!

Clean Review: simple excellent 100 needed small pair monitors use flat didnt want get evicted buying anything big usually use pair yamaha hs5s smooth transition coming pre sonus pros 1 sound nice crisp 2 band eq tailor high low frequencies not boomy flabby seem well 2 balanced inputs no noise running yamaha ag06 guys laptop no noise using unbalanced cables defintely prefeable 3 super light weight really light practical small work spaces portable rigs 4 price superb 80 90 best class without doubt cons 1 bass response wouldnt use mixing lower 80hz things simply not designed cones small look elsewhere want mix low frequencies 2 build quality seems good far time tell back saying broke months overall fantastic pair monitors bed room producers audiophiles alike
Review: simple excellent for under ¬£100. i needed a small pair of monitors to use in my flat, as i didnt want to get evicted buying anything too big..i usually use a pair of yamaha hs5s , and its been a smooth transition coming from those to the pre-sonus...pros:.1 - sound : nice and crisp with a 2-band eq to tailor the high and low frequencies. not boomy or flabby, and they seem to do well..2 - balanced inputs : no noise as i am running my yamaha ag06 into these guys from a laptop. there was no noise using unbalanced cables, but this is defintely prefeable..3 - super light-weight : really light and practical for small work-spaces or portable rigs..4 - price : superb for ¬£80-¬£90 best in class without a doubt...cons:.1 - bass response : i wouldnt use these for mixing lower than 80hz, as these things simply are not designed for that! the cones are too small, so look elsewhere if you want to mix low frequencies on it..2 - build quality : seems good so far, but only time will tell if i am back on here saying they broke after a few months...overall a fantastic pair of monitors for bed-room producers and audiophiles alike!
Title: simple excellent for under ¬£100

Review: presonus eris 4.5 great sound and price. great value and no issues with hum, hiss or buzzing as some people report. the sound is flat, clean and well difined. i'm using with native instruments komplete kontrol and arturia keyboard recording equipment. very impressed. if sub bass is important for general listening you may wish to use a sub woofer. i'm using a elac sub 2030, complemented with bose and yamaha equipment. these prosonus monitors are a fantastic purchase and i cannot believe the quality for price. there are better but you'll struggle to find anything of this quality for this price. regarding the hum etc i believe people experiencing this is likely to be the power supply picking up off other power supply's and equipment, try repossessioning them and us decent cables. even at high volume in a silent room i'm getting no hum or interference sounds very impressed. i would definitely recommend these monitors to anyone interested in home recording on a budget. added benefit of good inputs and fine tuning.
Title: presonus eris 4.5 great sound and price
Content: great value and no issues with hum, hiss or buzzing as some people report. the sound is flat, clean and well difined. i'm using with native instruments komplete kontrol and arturia keyboard recording equipment. very impressed. if sub bass is important for general listening you may wish to use a sub woofer. i'm using a elac sub 2030, complemented with bose and yamaha equipment. these prosonus monitors are a fantastic purchase and i cannot believe the quality for price. there are better but you'll struggle to find anything of this quality for this price. regarding the hum etc i believe people experiencing this is likely to be the power supply picking up off other power supply's and equipment, try repossessioning them and us decent cables. even at high volume in a silent room i'm getting no hum or interference sounds very impressed. i would definitely recommend these monitors to anyone interested in home recording on a budget. added benefit of good inputs and fine tuning.

Review: these are incredible for the price. ok, mostly great reviews and i am on board with that. for those talking about a hum - i don't have that with mine, though i am using high quality cables, so if that's something you're on the fence about, go get yourself a set of balanced or unbalanced connectors and hopefully you won't have that issue..i was on the fence because of the price - as in i thought it was too low for anything to be decent. i was wrong..response wise from this, i am blown away. it is simply incredible. thanks to the acoustic tuning, i have had no issues getting these monitors sounding great and clear in my studio. i only got these today and have spent a bit of time mixing to get a feel of the frequency response and so far, they have been outstanding. i record both rock, edm and a weird hybrid of the two and so far, everything is clear. if you hear muddiness - it's your mix, and eq is your friend..all in all, outstanding value and i feel these will serve me well for years to come.

Clean Review: unbeatable value looking set monitors mix live recordings not want spend much reading good reviews bought first tried tv media setup difference immediate nice balanced sound clarity definition really impressed later hooking studio bass immediately boomy presonus thought controls adapting listening environment gripe lack xlr although jack ins balanced make cable absolutely delighted monitors price sound fantastic
Review: unbeatable value. i was looking for a set of monitors to mix down live recordings but didn't want to spend much. after reading good reviews, i bought these. i first tried them on my tv/media setup and the difference was immediate! a very nice, balanced sound but it was the clarity and definition which really impressed. later, hooking them up in the studio, the bass was immediately boomy but presonus had thought of that with controls adapting to your listening environment. my only gripe is the lack of xlr in although the jack ins are balanced so i had to make up a cable for it. i am absolutely delighted with these monitors, for the price, they sound fantastic.

Review: get them! the best budget speaker for true clarity in your music. i've had a home studio now for a few years. regrettably, i had to sell a lot of my equipment last year, including my old monitors which were adam f5s. now i am slowly building up my home studio again from the bottom up. looking to get stuff on a budget and slowly upgrade bit by bit. after searching many reviews online about different monitors for a budget, i decided on these. what a great decision! i make house music and have had many chart entries on the digital stores, so i kinda know what i'm doing and these monitors are perfect for making music! can't believe the quality for the price. i wanted to have clarity and a flat, truthful sound. these give exactly that. i'm quite surprised at how loud they are for their size if i'm honest. even though that's not what i was after first and foremost. i can't recommend these enough, was a great decision. also i must report that i've got no hissing or humming issues that others have mentioned. can't wait to break these in properly and unlock their full potential.
Title: get them! the best budget speaker for true clarity in your music
Content: i've had a home studio now for a few years. regrettably, i had to sell a lot of my equipment last year, including my old monitors which were adam f5s. now i am slowly building up my home studio again from the bottom up. looking to get stuff on a budget and slowly upgrade bit by bit. after searching many reviews online about different monitors for a budget, i decided on these. what a great decision! i make house music and have had many chart entries on the digital stores, so i kinda know what i'm doing and these monitors are perfect for making music! can't believe the quality for the price. i wanted to have clarity and a flat, truthful sound. these give exactly that. i'm quite surprised at how loud they are for their size if i'm honest. even though that's not what i was after first and foremost. i can't recommend these enough, was a great decision. also i must report that i've got no hissing or humming issues that others have mentioned. can't wait to break these in properly and unlock their full potential.

Clean Review: nice micro active speakers ruined noisy electronics good bits 1 powerful amp capable filling average size room 2 speakers sound strong well balanced puchy top bottom ends fairly weak comparing beyerdynamic dt990 headphones 3 easy setup connection leads inputs speaker connections supplied power cable uk 3 pin plug bad bits sadly active speakers major problems makes unusable opinion 1 sound level left right not equal sitting middle triangle correct angle facing slave speaker quieter main powered one 2 loud mains hum breaks unfortunately power supply part internal electronics cant change 3 strange popping crackling sound seems cut verdict internal electronics appears badly designed built making speakers unusable reading reviews not one complaints reported suspect either bad batch simply not mark
Review: nice micro active speakers ruined by noisy electronics. the good bits:..1- powerful amp capable of filling average size room..2-the speakers sound is strong, well balanced and puchy. both top and bottom ends are fairly weak, but i am comparing these to beyerdynamic dt990 headphones..3- easy setup as all connection leads for inputs and speaker connections supplied and power cable has a uk 3 pin plug...the bad bits:.sadly these active speakers have some major problems that makes them unusable in my opinion...1- the sound level left and right is not equal. sitting in the middle of a triangle with correct angle of facing the slave speaker is quieter than the main powered one..2- there is a a loud mains hum that breaks through. unfortunately, the power supply is part of the internal electronics, so we cant change it..3- strange popping and crackling sound seems to cut in and out..verdict:..the internal electronics appears to be badly designed and built, making these speakers unusable. reading other reviews, this is not a one off as the same complaints have been reported.i suspect this is either a bad batch, or they are simply not up to the mark.
Title: nice micro active speakers ruined by noisy electronics
Content: the good bits:..1- powerful amp capable of filling average size room..2-the speakers sound is strong, well balanced and puchy. both top and bottom ends are fairly weak, but i am comparing these to beyerdynamic dt990 headphones..3- easy setup as all connection leads for inputs and speaker connections supplied and power cable has a uk 3 pin plug...the bad bits:.sadly these active speakers have some major problems that makes them unusable in my opinion...1- the sound level left and right is not equal. sitting in the middle of a triangle with correct angle of facing the slave speaker is quieter than the main powered one..2- there is a a loud mains hum that breaks through. unfortunately, the power supply is part of the internal electronics, so we cant change it..3- strange popping and crackling sound seems to cut in and out..verdict:..the internal electronics appears to be badly designed and built, making these speakers unusable. reading other reviews, this is not a one off as the same complaints have been reported.i suspect this is either a bad batch, or they are simply not up to the mark.

Review: forward, unbalanced sound. i so wanted to love these speakers, nearly everything about their design and sonic signature ticked all the boxes, other than the really forward upper midband around the crossover point (circa 2k-3k)...initially the forwardness makes the speakers sound bright and detailed, but in the long term this 'injected with adrenalin' presentation is artificial, fatiguing, and misguiding to mix with. you won't even realise you've subliminally compensated for their forwardness in the eq of your mixes until you play your music on more balanced speakers and wonder why your vocals and acoustic guitars sound recessed.Ôªø..i fully realise with speakers of this size and price it's about juggling compromises, but i know of ¬£30 single-driver bluetooth speakers which are nowhere near as good in absolute terms but which would be better to mix with because of their more natural tonal balance, so i can't help but feel the forward-leaning presentation of these speakers has been a deliberate design-choice to impress potential buyers in a-b in-store comparisons.
Title: forward, unbalanced sound
Content: i so wanted to love these speakers, nearly everything about their design and sonic signature ticked all the boxes, other than the really forward upper midband around the crossover point (circa 2k-3k)...initially the forwardness makes the speakers sound bright and detailed, but in the long term this 'injected with adrenalin' presentation is artificial, fatiguing, and misguiding to mix with. you won't even realise you've subliminally compensated for their forwardness in the eq of your mixes until you play your music on more balanced speakers and wonder why your vocals and acoustic guitars sound recessed.Ôªø..i fully realise with speakers of this size and price it's about juggling compromises, but i know of ¬£30 single-driver bluetooth speakers which are nowhere near as good in absolute terms but which would be better to mix with because of their more natural tonal balance, so i can't help but feel the forward-leaning presentation of these speakers has been a deliberate design-choice to impress potential buyers in a-b in-store comparisons.

Review: eris e4.5. no any severe hum or hiss as other described at times.. i did not purchase from amazon as found better deal elsewhere. early 'hours' so can't comment on many aspects yet. design is nice, speakers feels solid. sound is good to my ears thus far, not burned in yet although i don't really know if that will make a change. i can hear only very slight hum and hiss from about 2 feet away when in completely silent room. this is not annoying at all so i guess i must be lucky with my particular pair and others must have faulty units or units with different components inside. when my pc is turned on i can't hear any of that at all over my pc fans. happy with my purchase thus far.

Review: good sound, appalling mains hum. i bought these to replace the e3.5 which were recalled due to a power fault. at first, i was really pleased. the sound was great for the money; excellent flat for studio monitors. but then i noted the hum. it's awful. you can hear it above the computer fan. i sometimes even appears on recordings if i'm doing voice overs at the desk. as others have said, it really let's down an otherwise great product. i was going to buy another pair as a replacement in the hole mine was a one off, but having just googled reviews, i'm not the only one to have this problem. i'd give them a wide birth now. that's two of this company's speakers in a row that have been critically flawed. that's pretty poor.
Title: good sound, appalling mains hum
Content: i bought these to replace the e3.5 which were recalled due to a power fault. at first, i was really pleased. the sound was great for the money; excellent flat for studio monitors. but then i noted the hum. it's awful. you can hear it above the computer fan. i sometimes even appears on recordings if i'm doing voice overs at the desk. as others have said, it really let's down an otherwise great product. i was going to buy another pair as a replacement in the hole mine was a one off, but having just googled reviews, i'm not the only one to have this problem. i'd give them a wide birth now. that's two of this company's speakers in a row that have been critically flawed. that's pretty poor.

Review: good sound overall, but transformer/amp noise is disappointing. so far on the first day, seems to be overall a decent set of speakers. well designed in general, seem well made and pretty solid overall. tonal balance is *really* nice for the size and price point; they're nearly as sweet as my much more expensive hifi speakers and amp downstairs. bass is pretty well controlled and tight, treble sparkly and detailed, and the mids clear and defined. the adjustments on the back make it easy to tweak for your particular circumstances - i had to trim the 'acoustic space' control down to -2db or else the bass was too boomy, which is exactly what the manual suggested would be right for the setup i have them in, close to a wall...however, as others have pointed out, there is a noticeable, although not completely awful, ac mains hum, more prominent in the left active speaker but audible in the right speaker too if you listen closely. also audible when not playing anything is a high-pitched amplifier hiss/white noise in both speakers. both the hum and the white noise seem to be the same level whatever the volume knob is set to, whatever is plugged into the mains, which socket it's plugged into, or whatever is plugged into the speakers, although the noise gets a bit louder if the powered speaker has been on for a while and is warm. so it seems that whatever's picking up the noise/hum is after the input stages/preamp - maybe the power amp stage is being pushed a bit hard and/or as others have said, the transformer is a bit cheap and is unshielded...i think i can live with the hum and noise, at least right now. it's not offensive and it's less noisy than some other powered speakers i've had, but for a pair of speakers that claim to be 'high-definition studio monitors' it's a bit disappointing. guess i'll just have to make sure i turn them off when i'm not playing things on them...also the package that turned up was the continental european version of the speakers with a two-prong europlug cable, which was another disappointment. fortunately i
Title: good sound overall, but transformer/amp noise is disappointing
Content: so far on the first day, seems to be overall a decent set of speakers. well designed in general, seem well made and pretty solid overall. tonal balance is *really* nice for the size and price point; they're nearly as sweet as my much more expensive hifi speakers and amp downstairs. bass is pretty well controlled and tight, treble sparkly and detailed, and the mids clear and defined. the adjustments on the back make it easy to tweak for your particular circumstances - i had to trim the 'acoustic space' control down to -2db or else the bass was too boomy, which is exactly what the manual suggested would be right for the setup i have them in, close to a wall...however, as others have pointed out, there is a noticeable, although not completely awful, ac mains hum, more prominent in the left active speaker but audible in the right speaker too if you listen closely. also audible when not playing anything is a high-pitched amplifier hiss/white noise in both speakers. both the hum and the white noise seem to be the same level whatever the volume knob is set to, whatever is plugged into the mains, which socket it's plugged into, or whatever is plugged into the speakers, although the noise gets a bit louder if the powered speaker has been on for a while and is warm. so it seems that whatever's picking up the noise/hum is after the input stages/preamp - maybe the power amp stage is being pushed a bit hard and/or as others have said, the transformer is a bit cheap and is unshielded...i think i can live with the hum and noise, at least right now. it's not offensive and it's less noisy than some other powered speakers i've had, but for a pair of speakers that claim to be 'high-definition studio monitors' it's a bit disappointing. guess i'll just have to make sure i turn them off when i'm not playing things on them...also the package that turned up was the continental european version of the speakers with a two-prong europlug cable, which was another disappointment. fortunately i

Clean Review: bad transformer hum read lots excellent online reviews received monitors high expectations connected everything straight listened variety music check others saying must say sounded really good things quiet dreaded low level hum clearly audible fans computer disconnected cables hum still changed electrical sockets hum still hooked previous edifier monitors slight hum barely noticeable put ears near really hear read amazon uk review drew peacock 4th september 2016 highlighted source problem contacted supplier informed several units returned noisy transformer looks presonus lowered quality electronics recent batches monitors great pity respects really good price returned looking something else considering buying monitors suggest check recent online reviews mention transformer hum part cash hassle returning
Review: bad transformer hum. having read lots of excellent online reviews i received these monitors with high expectations. i connected everything up and straight off listened to a variety of music just to check what others had been saying. must say that they sounded really good. but then when things were quiet...the dreaded low level hum. clearly audible over the fans of the computer. i disconnected all cables, the hum was still there. i then changed electrical sockets but the hum was still there. i hooked up my previous edifier monitors and they only had a slight hum which was barely noticeable and you had to put your ears near them to really hear it. then i read the amazon uk review by drew peacock from 4th september 2016 which highlighted the source of the problem. i then contacted the supplier who informed me that they had had several units returned because of the noisy transformer...so it looks as if presonus have lowered the quality of the electronics in the recent batches of these monitors, which is a great pity, because in all other respects they were really good for the price. i have returned them and will be looking for something else. if you are considering buying these monitors i suggest you check other recent online reviews that mention the transformer hum before you part with your cash and have the hassle of returning them.

Clean Review: nice speakers design flaw results excessive mains hum left speaker hum actually think underplaying really bad especially quiet living room audible mains hum left speaker intolerable resolved mains hum issue solution ugly bought pair secondhand eris e4 5 couple days ago ebay instantly noticed hum main active speaker terriblle therefore consulted net read many reports hum therefore suspected design fault vs sold faulty pair speakers technical electronics background dismantled main speaker get bottom hum alas disappointing report concluded hum result major design fault presonus not believe actually slipped passed q testing presonus opted save dollars using cheap mains transformer vs better toroidal transformer cheap transformer spews mains emf radiation internally within left speaker enclosure small speaker radiation gets physically induced main power supply via large heatsink sits alongside transformer hum ends signal path also believe mains frequency magnetic coupling going mains transformer main lh speaker way resolve quickly cheaply extend wires feeding mains transformer relocate mains transformer outside speaker enclosure see attached photo major hack looks awful not seen deployment least eris e4 5 speakers totally hum free p initially thought audible hum insufficient capacitance psu 300mv peak peak ripple measured presonus used modest 4 700 capacitor two main psu rails added 10 000uf capacitance rail
Review: nice speakers, but a design flaw results in excessive mains hum in left speaker. re the hum, actually i think you're underplaying it...it's really bad (especially in a quiet living room where the audible mains hum in the left speaker is intolerable). i have resolved the mains hum issue....but the solution is ugly...so, i bought a pair of secondhand eris e4.5 a couple of days ago off ebay ...& instantly noticed the hum in the main active speaker was terriblle. i therefore consulted the net & read of many reports of this hum (i therefore suspected design fault, vs. being sold a faulty pair of speakers). so being of a technical/electronics background, i dismantled the main speaker to get to the bottom of the hum ....alas, it's disappointing to report that i've concluded that the hum is a result of a major design fault by presonus (i can't believe this has actually slipped passed their q&a testing)...presonus have opted to save a few dollars by using a cheap mains transformer (vs. a better toroidal transformer). this cheap transformer spews out mains emf radiation internally within the left speaker enclosure....& because it's a small speaker this radiation gets physically induced into the main power supply via the very large heatsink (which sits alongside the transformer) & then the hum ends up in the signal path...i also believe there is some mains frequency 'magnetic coupling' going on between the mains transformer & the main lh speaker itself. the only way i could resolve (quickly & cheaply) was to extend the wires feeding the mains transformer & then relocate the mains transformer outside of the speaker enclosure (see the attached photo) it's a major hack (& looks awful - but won't be seen in my deployment), but at least my eris e4.5 speakers are totally hum free now...p.s. i initially thought that the audible hum was down to insufficient capacitance on the psu ...300mv (peak to peak) of ripple measured on there (presonus used a modest 4,700 capacitor on each of the two main psu rails), so i added in a further 10,000uf capacitance to each rail.
Title: nice speakers, but a design flaw results in excessive mains hum in left speaker
Content: re the hum, actually i think you're underplaying it...it's really bad (especially in a quiet living room where the audible mains hum in the left speaker is intolerable). i have resolved the mains hum issue....but the solution is ugly...so, i bought a pair of secondhand eris e4.5 a couple of days ago off ebay ...& instantly noticed the hum in the main active speaker was terriblle. i therefore consulted the net & read of many reports of this hum (i therefore suspected design fault, vs. being sold a faulty pair of speakers). so being of a technical/electronics background, i dismantled the main speaker to get to the bottom of the hum ....alas, it's disappointing to report that i've concluded that the hum is a result of a major design fault by presonus (i can't believe this has actually slipped passed their q&a testing)...presonus have opted to save a few dollars by using a cheap mains transformer (vs. a better toroidal transformer). this cheap transformer spews out mains emf radiation internally within the left speaker enclosure....& because it's a small speaker this radiation gets physically induced into the main power supply via the very large heatsink (which sits alongside the transformer) & then the hum ends up in the signal path...i also believe there is some mains frequency 'magnetic coupling' going on between the mains transformer & the main lh speaker itself. the only way i could resolve (quickly & cheaply) was to extend the wires feeding the mains transformer & then relocate the mains transformer outside of the speaker enclosure (see the attached photo) it's a major hack (& looks awful - but won't be seen in my deployment), but at least my eris e4.5 speakers are totally hum free now...p.s. i initially thought that the audible hum was down to insufficient capacitance on the psu ...300mv (peak to peak) of ripple measured on there (presonus used a modest 4,700 capacitor on each of the two main psu rails), so i added in a further 10,000uf capacitance to each rail.

Content: great speakers. nice bass, mid and treble. my first monitor speakers, and very, very pleased. hooked up to my pc, and i can no listen to all my tunes without any distortion. got some audio foam for the base, just to limit any rattling, none at all. brilliant, and at the price they are now, ¬£116, an absolute steal. even at top price, people were saying these speakers give great value for money. just over ¬£50 for each speaker is the bargain of the year!

Review: awesome monitors, everything i wanted in a pair of miniature powered speakers. these monitors are a revelation!..everything i wanted in a miniature monitor is basically provided: sounds pop out of the speakers in a three-dimensional way, there is crisp and clean treble, clear and realistic mid-range, and a very reasonable amount of bass for the size. stereo imaging is good, and i have not found them at all fatiguing to listen to...as with most other ported designs, in an untreated room at close proximity to walls, i find it's best to roll off the bass with one of the "low cutoff" settings at the back (80 hz or 100 hz). but even at 80 hz, there is still an adequate amount of bass produced for most scenarios, and what is there sounds tight and controlled...sometimes i've heard details on these monitors that i never noticed before when listening to the same music on larger, much more expensive monitors. i suspect that's partly due simply to the size of the cabinets - i suspect smaller speakers are going to exhibit less masking of mid-range elements by bass sounds; or maybe it's due to a higher crossover frequency. i'm not sure. but it's also a testament to how good these monitors are. given the price, they are amazing...i have the monitors placed high up, so they're slightly above head level, tilted downwards so they're pointing directly at my head in normal sitting position. i find this sounds much better than putting them low down at desk level and tilting them upwards, presumably because there are less reflections off the desk itself...i did this by placing a pair of pixel t50 speaker stands (50cm tall, costing ¬£50) on my desk, just behind my displays - the stands are the perfect height to hold the monitors so their front faces are just above my displays. i then used a pair of foam isolation pads to rest the monitors on and tilt them downwards at the right angle. for this i used a pair of adam hall pad eco series absorber plates, which are the right width for these monitors.

Clean Review: great budget monitors check voltage selector plugging excellent buy go great presonus studio 1 firebox mixing via headphones hi fi speakers monitors make world difference one caveat manual says voltage selector speakers set country purchased mine not needed changing make sure check avoid blown fuse worse also came wrong power lead although annoying price still worth five stars
Review: great budget monitors but check voltage selector before plugging in!. excellent buy. go great with my presonus studio 1 and firebox. i had been mixing via headphones and hi fi speakers. the monitors make a world of difference. one caveat the manual says that voltage selector on the speakers will be set to that of the country where purchased mine wasn't and needed changing - make sure you check it to avoid a blown fuse - or worse!. also came with the wrong power lead. although annoying, for the price, these are still worth five stars.

Review: fantastic, clear sound in a very compact package. fantastic, clear sound in a very compact package. that being said, i do get a tiny bit of (mains?) hum from them, and (as other reviewers have noticed) they're not 100% screened against external interference - they will occasionally pickup my mobile, possibly over the speaker cable link to the passive speaker..but the sound is excellent, great bass for a set this size, and the build quality is rock solid.
